description:
These are the traits for characters' [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hair_color]hair colors[/url] and [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hair_style]hairstyles[/url]. Said hair does not need to be real, it can be a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wig]wig[/url] or something else.

Do not create child tags related to hair accessories and headwear here, use the clothing trait group headwear section instead.
name: Hair

description:
These are the traits for characters' hair colors. It doesn't matter if this hair color is natural or a result of some conditions affecting hair color.

See the [url=https://s.vndb.org/sf/33/126533.jpg]VNDB Hair Color Chart[/url] for examples of each hair color in the database. Please always refer to this chart when in doubt.

Note 1: if a character's hair color is ambiguous and cannot be described with a single color, tagging the character with multiple color traits is allowed. (Example: [url=http://vndb.org/c10551]Crayanne[/url])

Note 2: if a character has several well distinguishable colors in his/her hair, please use the [url=http://vndb.org/i894]Multicolored[/url] trait along with the relevant color traits. (Example: [url=http://vndb.org/c10040]Aaron Vanich[/url])
name: Hair Color

description:
This character has black hair.

Please see the [url=https://s.vndb.org/sf/33/126533.jpg]VNDB Hair Color Chart[/url] for examples when in doubt.
name: Black

description:
This character has blond hair.

Please see the [url=https://s.vndb.org/sf/33/126533.jpg]VNDB Hair Color Chart[/url] for examples when in doubt.
name: Blond

description:
This character has brown hair.

Please see the [url=https://s.vndb.org/sf/33/126533.jpg]VNDB Hair Color Chart[/url] for examples when in doubt.
name: Brown

description:
This character has blue hair.

Please see the [url=https://s.vndb.org/sf/33/126533.jpg]VNDB Hair Color Chart[/url] for examples when in doubt.
name: Blue

description:
This character has pink hair.

Please see the [url=https://s.vndb.org/sf/33/126533.jpg]VNDB Hair Color Chart[/url] for examples when in doubt.
name: Pink

description:
This character has purple hair.

Please see the [url=https://s.vndb.org/sf/33/126533.jpg]VNDB Hair Color Chart[/url] for examples when in doubt.
name: Violet

description:
This character has red hair.

Please see the [url=https://s.vndb.org/sf/33/126533.jpg]VNDB Hair Color Chart[/url] for examples when in doubt.
name: Red

description:
This character has white hair.

Please see the [url=https://s.vndb.org/sf/33/126533.jpg]VNDB Hair Color Chart[/url] for examples when in doubt.
name: White

description: These are the traits for characters' [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hair_style]hairstyles[/url]. It doesn't matter if this hair style is natural or a result of some conditions affecting hair style.
name: Hairstyle

description:
This character's hair has an [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Glossary_of_anime_and_manga]ahoge[/url].

An ahoge is a single strand of hair that sticks out of a character's head.
name: Ahoge

description:
This character's hair has an [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Glossary_of_anime_and_manga]antenna[/url].

An antenna is a variation of ahoge, which is when there are two or more locks of hair sticking up as opposed to one.
name: Antenna

description:
This character has a scalp wholly lacking in hair.

It can be a result of [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Baldness]baldness[/url] and/or [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Head_shaving]shaving the head[/url].
name: Bald

description:
This character has [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bun_%28hairstyle%29]bun hairstyle[/url].

A bun is a type of hairstyle, typically worn by women, where the hair is pulled back from the face, twisted or plaited, and wrapped in a circular coil around itself, typically on the back of the head or neck. They can either be secured with a hairpiece, a hairnet and bobby pins. They may be tightly gathered or slightly messier and more informal.
name: Bun

description:
This character has [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bun_%28hairstyle%29#Double_bun]double bun hairstyle[/url].

A bun is a type of hairstyle, typically worn by women, where the hair is pulled back from the face, twisted or plaited, and wrapped in a circular coil around itself, typically on the back of the head or neck. They can either be secured with a hairpiece, a hairnet and bobby pins. They may be tightly gathered or slightly messier and more informal. A double bun is a variation of this hairstyle featuring two of these buns.
name: Odango

description:
This character has [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ponytail]ponytail hairstyle[/url].

A ponytail is a hairstyle in which most or all of the hair on the head is pulled away from the face, gathered and secured at the back of the head with a hair tie, clip or similar device, and allowed to hang freely from that point.
name: Ponytail

description:
This character has [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bunches]bunches hairstyle[/url].

Bunches, also called angel wings and pigtails, are a hairstyle in which the hair is parted down the middle and gathered into two symmetrical bundles, like ponytails, secured near the scalp. In some English-speaking regions, this hairstyle is referred to as "pigtails," but in others, the term "pigtails" applies only if the hair is braided.
name: Twin Tails

description:
This character has [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bob_cut]bob cut hairstyle[/url].

A "bob cut" is a short haircut for men and women in which the hair is typically cut straight around the head at about jaw-length, often with a fringe (or "bangs") at the front.
name: Bob Cut

description:
This character has [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hime_cut]hime cut hairstyle[/url].

A hime cut is a hairstyle consisting of straight, cheek to chin length sidelocks and blunt bangs. With the rest of the hair longer than the shoulders and straightened.
name: Hime Cut

description:
This character has [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Long_hair]long hair[/url].

Long hair is used when referring to hair longer than shoulder length.
name: Long

description:
This character has [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Long_hair]very long hair[/url].

Very long hair is used when referring to hair at waist length or longer.
name: Waist Length+

description:
This character has wavy hair.

Wavy hair is used when referring to hair that have waves.
name: Wavy

description:
This character has [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Curtained_hair]curtained hairstyle[/url].

Curtained hair is the term given to the hairstyle featuring a long fringe divided in either a middle parting or a side parting. When used, it generally applies to males.
name: Curtained

description:
This character's hair is at medium length.

Medium hair is used when referring to hair longer than short hair up to shoulder length.
name: Shoulder-length

description:
This character has [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mullet_%28haircut%29]mullet hairstyle[/url].

The mullet is a hairstyle that is short at the front and sides, and long in the back.
name: Mullet

description:
This character has [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pixie_cut]pixie cut hairstyle[/url].

A pixie cut refers to a short woman's hairstyle generally short on the back and sides of the head and slightly longer on the top.
name: Pixie Cut

description:
This character's hair is short.

Short hair is used when referring to hair at short length overall.
name: Short

description: This character has [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Straight_hair#Straight_hair]straight hair[/url].
name: Straight

description:
This character's hairstyle has a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kemonomimi]kemonomimi[/url], animal ears, shape.

Kemonomimi, literally meaning "animal ears", is based on the the concept of drawing animals as bishoujo or having bishoujo wear or have animal accessories (such as ears or tails). Catgirls are the most prolific in this category, although bunnygirls, foxgirls, and dog girls are also common.

Kemonomimi characters typically appear human except for added animal-like qualities.

This trait is intended for characters with hair styles that look like animal ears. And it should not be mixed with the other two kemonomimi traits:
Clothes > [url=http://vndb.org/i153]Kemonomimi Headband[/url] refers to characters wearing head accessories animal ears and
Body > [url=http://vndb.org/i677]Kemonomimi[/url] refers to humanoid characters with actual animal ears.
name: Kemonomimi

description: These are the traits for the characters' [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Facial_Hair]facial hair[/url].
name: Facial Hair

description:
These are the traits for the characters' [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Beard]beard[/url].

A beard is the collection of hair that grows on the chin, cheeks and neck, but not the upper lip, of human beings
name: Beard

description:
These are the traits for the characters' [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Moustache]moustache[/url].

A moustache is facial hair grown on the outer surface of the upper lip.
name: Moustache

description: These are the traits about characters' [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Eye]eyes[/url].
name: Eyes

description: These are the traits for characters' [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Human_physical_appearance]physical appearance[/url].
name: Body

description: These are the traits for the characters' [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Clothing]clothing[/url] and [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Personal_armour]armor[/url].
name: Clothes

description: These are the traits for the things characters carry around with them most of the time, things that they can be identified with.
name: Items

description:
These are the [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Trait_theory]traits for characters' personality[/url].

These traits are planned to be the ones that are about how characters act, so even if the trait you thought about sounds closer to a role, put the it here if it is more about characters' mindsets.
name: Personality

description:
These are the traits for the characters' [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Role]roles[/url] in the game's story.

They usually apply to characters' current vocation, or social state, but also apply to their previous ones if those are a part of the story.

Do not mix with the term "Role" for their character types such as protagonist, hero/heroine.

While these traits might sound a bit off as a characters role in a story if you think it alone, like "this characters role in this game isn't being an American", think them more along the lines of: "Alex plays the role of an American soldier in this story.". As long as a trait can fit to this structure it can be used as a role trait.
name: Role

description: These are the traits for the actions characters engage in, usually by their own initiative.
name: Engages in

description: These are the traits for the actions characters get subjected to by others and situations that they are being the subject of.
name: Subject of

description:
These are the traits related to [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Human_sexual_activity]sexual activities[/url].

These traits are intended to be used on a single character for a sexual act, instead of both characters involved. The aim is to clarify the confusion of which one is being the active and which one is being the passive partner in such acts.

"Engages in" sexual traits should be applied to the character stimulating their partner's genitals for non-penetrative and oral sexual acts, and to the penetrating party for penetrative sexual acts.
name: Engages in (Sexual)

description:
These are the traits for characters' apparent age. Listed age categories are designed based on the concepts from [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Erikson%27s_stages_of_psychosocial_development]Erikson's stages of psychosocial development[/url].

Note that these traits only signify the physical appearance of characters, and they might not reflect actual age.
name: Apparent Age

description: These are the traits for characters' [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Somatotype_and_constitutional_psychology]body type[/url] and height.
name: Body Type

description: These are the traits for any distinctive visible markings on characters' bodies such as [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tattoo]tattoos[/url] and [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Scar]scars[/url].
name: Markings

description: These are the traits about characters' [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Eye_colors]eye colors[/url].
name: Eye Color

description:
This character [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cross-dressing]cross-dresses[/url].

Cross-dressing is the wearing of clothing and other accoutrement commonly associated with a gender within a particular society that is seen as different than the one usually presented by the dresser. Cross-dressing has been used for disguise, performance art and as a literary trope in modern times and throughout history.
name: Cross-dressing

description:
This character displays [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Transgender]transgender[/url] behavior.

Transgender is the state of one's "gender identity" (self-identification as woman, man, neither or both) not matching one's "assigned sex" (identification by others as male, female or intersex based on physical/genetic sex).

"Transgender" does not imply any specific form of sexual orientation; transgender people may identify as heterosexual, homosexual, bisexual, pansexual, polysexual, or asexual; some may consider conventional sexual orientation labels inadequate or inapplicable to them.

This trait refers to characters acting outside the social norms of their physical gender. It does not necessarily cover looking, dressing like or claiming to be of that gender.
name: Transgender

description:
This character has green hair.

Please see the [url=https://s.vndb.org/sf/33/126533.jpg]VNDB Hair Color Chart[/url] for examples when in doubt.
name: Green

description:
This character is a boy who looks like, or is usually mistaken, for a girl.

Dressing and acting like a girl is optional.

"Trap" does not imply any specific form of sexual orientation but only the physical appearance.

This trait is used for works that frame a male character as female in order to "trap" the player, or for those VNs with the characters that explicitly identify as "traps".

For gender ambiguous body types use [url=/i1519]Androgynous[/url] instead. Do not apply the trait to [url=/i49]transgender[/url] characters, as that is a separate fetish. A possible exception could be allowed, if the character starts as a Trap and later transitions during the course of the story.
name: Trap

description:
This character is a girl who looks like, and is usually mistaken, for a boy.

Dressing and acting like a boy is optional.

"Trap" does not imply any specific form of sexual orientation but only the physical appearance.

This trait is to be used for works that explicitly frame a female character as male in order to "trap" the player. For gender ambiguous body types use [url=/i1519]Androgynous[/url] instead. For characters whose self-described gender identity does not match their sex, use [url=/i49]Transgender[/url].

Do not apply the trait to transsexual characters, as it is a separate fetish. A possible exception could be allowed, if the character starts as a Reverse-trap and later transitions during the course of the story.
name: Reverse-trap

description: This character has [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Eye_colors#Brown]brown eyes[/url].
name: Brown

description:
This character has the [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Human_physical_appearance]physical appearance[/url] of a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/teen]teen[/url] of ages 13 to 19.

Note that this trait only signifies the physical appearance of this character, and it may not reflect actual age.
name: Teen

description: This character has an [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ectomorphic]ectomorphic[/url] body type characterized by long and thin muscles/limbs and low fat storage; usually referred to as slim.
name: Slim

description: These are the important features about characters' bodies.
name: Features

description:
These are the traits for characters' apparent [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Skin_color#Skin_tone_variability]skin tones[/url].

Note that these traits only signify the physical appearance of characters, and they do not reflect race or ethnicity.
name: Skin Tone

description: This character has a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Light_skin#Light_skin]light skin tone[/url].
name: Pale

description: These are the traits for the characters' clothing worn over others, or ones that cover their entire body or worn as a set. Like a robe or uniform.
name: Over Body Clothing

description:
This character wears a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Uniform]uniform[/url].

A uniform is a set of standard clothing worn by members of an organization while participating in that organization's activity.
name: Uniform

description:
This character wears a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/School_uniform]school uniform[/url].

A school uniform is an outfit—a set of standardized clothes—worn primarily for an educational institution.
name: School Uniform

description: These are the traits for all kinds of clothing and accessories worn on the upper part of the body including arms, hands and neck.
name: Upper Body Clothing

description:
This character wears a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sweater]sweater[/url].

A sweater is a garment intended to cover the torso and arms.
name: Sweater

description: These are the traits for all kinds of clothing and accessories worn on the lower part of the body, such as skirts and socks.
name: Lower Body Clothing

description:
This character wears [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Trousers]trousers[/url].

Trousers are an item of clothing worn on the lower part of the body from the waist to the ankles, covering both legs separately.
name: Trousers

description:
This character is wearing [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Shoes]shoes[/url].

A shoe is an item of footwear intended to protect and comfort the human foot while doing various activities. Shoes are also used as an item of decoration.
name: Shoes

description:
This character wears [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dress_shoe]dress shoes[/url].

A dress shoe is a shoe to be worn at smart casual or more formal events.
name: Dress Shoes

description:
These are the traits for [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Personal_weapon]personal weapons[/url] that characters are seen with during the story.

A personal weapon is a weapon that can be carried and employed by a single person, although its use may be restricted to specialist members of attack or defense teams.
name: Weapons

description:
This character has a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dao_%28sword%29]dao[/url].

Dao is actually a generic word used to denote any member of a family of single-edged, broad-bladed cutting or slicing tools, but in common, everyday usage means knife.

Dao blades are moderately curved and single-edged, though often with few inches of the back edge sharpened as well; the moderate curve allows them to be reasonably effective in the thrust. Hilts are canted, curving in the opposite direction as the blade which improves handling in some forms of cuts and thrusts.
name: Dao

description:
This character has a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dadao]dadao[/url].

Based on agricultural knives, dadao have broad blades generally between two and three feet long, long hilts meant for "hand and a half" or two-handed use, and generally a weight-forward balance.
name: Dadao

description:
This character has a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Shinai]shinai[/url].

Shinai is a weapon used for practice and competition in kendo representing a Japanese sword.

The shinai comprises four slats known as take, usually made from dried bamboo, which are held together by three leather fittings: a hilt, or handle fitting; a fitting at the tip and a leather strip that binds the four slats. The parts are all secured with a string.
name: Shinai

description:
This character has a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sword]sword[/url].

A sword is a long, edged piece of forged metal, used in many civilizations throughout the world, primarily as a cutting or thrusting weapon and occasionally as a clubbing or bludgeoning weapon.
name: Sword

description:
The opposite of [url=http://vndb.org/i216]Hetare[/url].

You can rely on this type of characters to do what needs to be done. They aren't afraid to make decisions. They take the initiative and solve the problem, usually by themselves. Once they have a goal in mind, they'll approach it with prudence and tact.

They usually have talent/ability or connections that they know how to make best use of.

Check [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Proactivity_%28Proactive_behavior%29]proactivity[/url] or [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Conscientiousness]conscientious[/url] for more details.

Should only be used when the character acted like this for the majority of the game.
name: Proactive

description:
This character is blind against all romantic feelings and actions of people nearby.

Donkan characters can't read the atmosphere at all. Some donkans may be smart like a genius but they still can't understand the romantic feelings of anyone until a clear confession is made. Even than they need to ask for a confirmation and think about it for a while.
name: Donkan

description:
This character is a hardworking person.

Hardworker refers to a person that spends a lot of effort to succeed at the assigned tasks and achieve his/her goals.
name: Hard Worker

description:
This character is a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Master_%28form_of_address%29]master[/url].

A master is an employer of workers or servants, usually of a large estate or household.
name: Master

description:
This character is a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Student]student[/url].

A student is a learner, or someone who attends an educational institution.

This trait is intended to be used for students that are not a member of the child traits such as high school student or university student. If a character is a member of those please use the appropriate trait instead.
name: Student

description:
This character is a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Magician_%28fantasy%29]magician[/url].

A magician is someone who uses or practices magic that derives from supernatural or occult sources.

This trait signifies a character capable of casting magic spells, it does not necessarily mean that the character actually does so during the story.
name: Magician

description:
This character is a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Warrior]warrior[/url].

A warrior is a person experienced in or capable of engaging in combat or warfare.

This trait is intended to cover all characters that had some self-defense and weapons training, it does not mean that all of these people are war veterans.
name: Warrior

description:
This character plays [url=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Association_football]football[/url].

Soccer is a sport played between two teams of eleven players with a spherical ball. The game is played on a rectangular field of grass or green artificial turf, with a goal in the middle of each of the short ends. The object of the game is to score by driving the ball into the opposing goal.

In general play, the goalkeepers are the only players allowed to touch the ball with their hands or arms, while the field players typically use their feet to kick the ball into position, occasionally using their torso or head to intercept a ball in midair. The team that scores the most goals by the end of the match wins.
name: Soccer

description:
This character is a practitioner of  [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Swordsmanship]swordsmanship[/url].

Swordsmanship refers to the skills of a swordsman, a person versed in the art of the sword. The term is modern, and as such was mainly used to refer to smallsword fencing, but by extension it can also be applied to any martial art involving the use of a sword.
name: Swordsmanship

description:
This character is a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hero]hero[/url].

Hero refer to characters who, in the face of danger and adversity or from a position of weakness, display courage and the will for self sacrifice—that is, heroism—for some greater good of all humanity. This definition originally referred to martial courage or excellence but extended to more general moral excellence.

This trait is for characters moral quality and should not be mixed with their roles in games such as a protagonist or hero/heroine of a VN.
name: Hero

description:
This character is a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Villain]villain[/url].

A villain is an "evil" character in a story, whether a historical narrative or, especially, a work of fiction. The villain is usually (but not necessarily) the antagonist, the character who tends to have a negative effect on other characters. In some cases villain might be friendly with the main characters, or even BE one of the main characters (more common in grey morality settings).

A character may start as a villain or hero and later switch to the other side, this trait should be used in either case.
name: Villain

description:
This character is an [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Orphan]orphan[/url].

An orphan is a child permanently bereaved of his or her parents. In common usage, only a child who has lost both parents is called an orphan. However, adults can also be referred to as orphans, or "adult orphans".
name: Orphan

description:
This character [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cooking]cooks[/url].

Cooking is the process of preparing food with heat. 

This trait should be used for characters with cooking related scenes, and not just because they are professional cooks.
name: Cooking

description:
This character engages in [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Combat]combat[/url].

The term combat (French for fight) typically refers to armed conflict between military forces in warfare, whereas the more general term "fighting" can refer to any violent conflict. Combat violence can be unilateral, whereas fighting implies at least a defensive reaction.
name: Fighting

description:
This character wears a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fedora]fedora[/url].

A fedora is a men's felt hat that is creased lengthwise down the crown and pinched in the front on both sides. The creasing does not define the hat, however. Fedoras can also be creased with teardrop crowns, diamond crowns, center dents, and others, and the positioning of pinches can vary if they are found at all.
name: Fedora

description:
This character becomes a victim of a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Disaster]disaster[/url].

A disaster is a natural or man-made hazard that has come to fruition, resulting in an event of substantial extent causing significant physical damage or destruction, loss of life, or drastic change to the environment. A disaster can be ostensively defined as any tragic event with great loss stemming from events such as earthquakes, floods, catastrophic accidents, fires, or explosions.
name: Disaster

description:
This character gets [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Assault]assaulted[/url].

Assault is a crime of violence against another person. The specific meaning of assault varies between countries, but can refer to an act that causes another to apprehend immediate and personal violence, or in the more limited sense of a threat of violence caused by an immediate show of force.

Assault is often defined to include not only violence, but any intentional physical contact with another person without their consent.

This trait is intended to be used in situations that the victim can't or doesn't fight back, at least on an equal level to make the situation more of a fight then an attack. In the other case, please use the Fighting trait.
name: Assault

description:
This character suffers from [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Amnesia]amnesia[/url].

Amnesia is a condition in which memory is disturbed or lost.

The causes of amnesia have traditionally been divided into categories. Functional causes are psychological factors, such as mental disorder, post-traumatic stress or, in psychoanalytic terms, defense mechanisms.
name: Amnesia

description:
These are the traits about [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sexual_positions]sex positions[/url]. These traits are for the penetrated partner(s). Traits for the penetrating partner(s) are under [url=/i1649]i1649[/url].

Sex positions are positions which people may adopt during or for the purpose of sexual intercourse or other sexual activities.

These traits may be applied not only to characters using these positions for vaginal sex, but also to characters using them for anal sex, pegging, tribadism (between lesbians), frot (between gays), or sex with a double ended dildo. Even though neither partner is penetrated in tribadism or frot, and both partners are penetrated in sex with a double ended dildo, use the matching traits under [url=/i43]Engages in (Sexual)[/url] > [url=/i1649]Sex Positions[/url] and [url=/i1625]Subject of (Sexual)[/url] > [url=/i92]Sex Positions[/url] to indicate which character was in which position.
name: Sex Positions

description:
This character has sex in the [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sexual_positions#Penetrating_partner_on_top_with_front_entry]missionary[/url] position. Apply this trait to the penetrated partner and apply [url=/i1694]i1694[/url] to the penetrating partner.

In this position, the receiving partner lies on their back with their legs apart, while the penetrating partner lies, (or supports themselves) on top.

This is similar to some of the [url=https://vndb.org/i1700]butterfly[/url] positions except the penetrating partner's torso is closer to horizontal instead of vertical.

[url=https://s.vndb.org/sf/71/84171.jpg]Example[/url]
name: Missionary

description:
This character has sex in the [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sex_positions#Penetrating_from_behind]doggy[/url] position. Apply this trait to the penetrated partner and apply [url=/i1692]i1692[/url] to the penetrating partner.

In this position, the receiving partner crouches on all fours (ie, on their hands and knees), while the penetrating partner kneels behind them. Alternatively, the receiving partner may angle their torso downwards and use their elbows, shoulders or chest for support instead of their hands. The penetrating partner may also hold one of the receiver's legs up.

In another variant (the [url=/i1327]Quickie Fix[/url] position), the receiving partner stands on their feet in a bent-over position, while the penetrating partner stands behind them.

[url=https://s.vndb.org/sf/66/84166.jpg]Example 1[/url] - Receiving partner on all-fours
[url=https://s.vndb.org/sf/67/84167.jpg]Example 2[/url] - Receiving partner angled downwards
name: Doggy Style

description:
This character has sex in the [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Woman_on_top#Cowgirl_position]cowgirl[/url] position. Apply this trait to the penetrated partner and apply [url=/i1689]i1689[/url] to the penetrating partner.

In this position, the penetrating partner lies on their back, while the receiving partner straddles them, typically in a kneeling or squatting position, with their torso mostly upright. The participants face each other.

Use the [url=/i1069]reverse cowgirl[/url] trait if the receiving partner faces away.

[url=https://s.vndb.org/sf/87/14787.jpg]Example 1[/url], [url=https://s.vndb.org/sf/32/84132.jpg]Example 2[/url], [url=https://s.vndb.org/sf/33/84133.jpg]Example 3[/url] - Kneeling
[url=https://s.vndb.org/sf/34/84134.jpg]Example 4[/url] - Squatting
[url=https://s.vndb.org/sf/86/51786.jpg]Example 5[/url] - Neither kneeling or squatting
name: Cowgirl

description:
This character has sex in a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sex_positions#Standing]standing[/url] position. Apply this trait to the penetrated partner and apply [url=/i1698]i1698[/url] to the penetrating partner.

There are several different positions that may be considered "standing", but they all involve at least one participant standing on their feet, and both participants with their torso upright. The receiving partner may be penetrated from in front, or behind. In one variant, both participants stand upright, possibly leaning on a wall for support. In another variant, the penetrating partner carries the receiving partner.

[url=https://s.vndb.org/sf/79/53779.jpg]Example 1[/url] - Both participants standing, one leaning on a glass wall. Similar to [url=/i1327]quickie fix[/url] except the receiving partner is more upright.
[url=https://s.vndb.org/sf/09/84309.jpg]Example 2[/url], [url=https://s.vndb.org/sf/11/84311.jpg]Example 3[/url] - Receiving partner carried by penetrating partner, participants facing each other.
[url=https://s.vndb.org/sf/10/84310.jpg]Example 4[/url] - Receiving partner carried by penetrating partner, participants facing away from each other.
name: Standing Sex

description:
This character has sex in the [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Spoons_sex_position]spoons[/url] position. Apply this trait to the penetrated partner and apply [url=/i1697]i1697[/url] to the penetrating partner.

In this position, the receiving partner lies on their side, while the penetrating partner also lies on their side, behind the receiving partner, facing the same direction. The participants may or may not press their upper bodies together.

[url=https://s.vndb.org/sf/20/85320.jpg]Example[/url]
name: Spoons

description:
These are the traits about [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Oral_sex]oral sex[/url]. These traits are for the performing partner(s). Traits for the receiving partner(s) are under [url=/i1634]i1634[/url].

Oral sex may or may not be penetrative, and is the term given to genital stimulation by the mouth. People may engage in oral sex as part of foreplay before intercourse, or as, during or following intercourse. It may also be performed for its own sake, and can be performed simultaneously.
name: Oral Sex

description:
This character performs [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fellatio]fellatio[/url]. Apply [url=/i1637]i1637[/url] to the receiving character.

Fellatio is the act of using the mouth, lips, and tongue to stimulate the penis. [url=/i101]Cunnilingus[/url] may be considered the equivalent trait for a female receiver.
name: Blowjob

description:
This character performs [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cunnilingus]cunnilingus[/url]. Apply [url=/i1636]i1636[/url] to the receiving character.

Cunnilingus is the act of using the mouth, lips and tongue to stimulate the female genitals. [url=/i100]Blowjob[/url] may be considered the equivalent trait for a male receiver.
name: Cunnilingus

description:
This character engages in the [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/69_%28sex_position%29]sixty-nine[/url] position.

In the sixty-nine position, two people position themselves so that each person's mouth is near the other's genitals, and simultaneously perform oral sex.

[url=https://s.vndb.org/sf/04/7004.jpg][Example][/url]
name: Sixty-nine

description:
This character performs [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Anilingus]anilingus[/url]. Apply [url=/i1635]i1635[/url] to the receiving character.

Anilingus is a form of oral sex involving contact between the anus or perineum of one person and the mouth of another.
name: Anilingus

description:
This character has a sex scene where they lose their virginity by penetrating or being penetrated by another character. The usual bleeding for females need not be shown, but then it must be mentioned in the game (or in a trusted source like the game's website) that this was the first time this character had sex.

Self-penetration or masturbation does not count as virginity loss, even if a female character loses her hymen in that way.

This trait can be used for both male and female characters. Do not use it on characters that have sex with a virgin, but are not virgins themselves.
name: Virgin Sex

description:
This character engages in [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Group_sex]group sex[/url].

Group sex is sexual behavior involving more than two participants. Group sex can occur amongst people of all sexual orientations and genders.

The following traits are for the active or performing participant(s). Traits for the passive or receiving participant(s) are under [url=/i1625]Subject of (Sexual)[/url]>[url=/i1687]Group Sex[/url]. Traits under [url=/i2965]Group Sex Participants[/url] are an exception from this rule, as they don't have counterparts.
name: Group Sex

description:
This character has a sex scene with someone other than the protagonist.

Don't use this trait for group sex scenes that the protagonist is also a part of.
name: Sex with Others

description:
This character is hotblooded.

Hotblooded characters feel extremely passionate about something, for example justice, love or protecting someone. This passion is to such a degree that nothing can stop the hotblooded character from reaching it, not the laws of physics nor death.

They usually appear in stories in the form of heroes or villains that refuse to stop or die no matter what, unless their will is broken.
name: Hotblooded

description:
This character has [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Eye_colors#Amber]amber eyes[/url].

Amber eyes are of a solid color and have a strong yellowish/golden and russet/coppery tint. It is a very rare eye color and also known as ‘wolf eyes’, since amber eye color is very common in wolves.
name: Amber

description:
This character has black eye color.

Black is amongst the rarest eye colors in the world. Most of the people who appear to have black eyes have, infact, extremely dark brown eyes that seem to be black.
name: Black

description: This character has [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Eye_colors#Blue]blue eyes[/url].
name: Blue

description: This character has [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Eye_colors#Gray]grey eyes[/url].
name: Grey

description: This character has [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Eye_colors#Green]green eyes[/url].
name: Green

description:
This character has [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Eye_colors#Hazel]hazel eyes[/url].

Hazel eyes often appear to shift in color from a light brown to a golden-green. Hazel mostly consists of brown and green. The dominant color in the eye can either be green or light brown/gold. This is how many people mistake hazel eyes to be amber and vice versa. This can sometimes produce a multicolored iris, i.e., an eye that is light brown/amber near the pupil and charcoal or dark green on the outer part of the iris (and vice versa) when observed in sunlight.
name: Hazel

description:
This character has purple eye color.

It is not a natural eye color in the real world.
name: Violet

description:
This character has [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Eye_colors#Red]red eyes[/url].

Red is probably the rarest eye color amongst the human population of the world. It is mainly seen in case of albinos and is the result of either large quantities of the "normally scarce" red areas in the eyes or a small leakage of blood into the iris.
name: Red

description: This characters' eyes are hidden, their color or other properties are unknown.
name: Hidden

description:
This character has white eye color.

It can be either of pure white with no iris, or colored pupils with white iris.
name: White

description:
This character has the [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Human_physical_appearance]physical appearance[/url] of a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Child]child[/url] of age 12 or lower.

Note that this trait only signifies the physical appearance of this character, and it may not reflect actual age.
name: Kid

description:
This character has the [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Human_physical_appearance]physical appearance[/url] of a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/young-adult]young-adult[/url] of ages 20 to 39.

Note that this trait only signifies the physical appearance of this character, and it may not reflect actual age.
name: Young-adult

description:
This character has the [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Human_physical_appearance]physical appearance[/url] of an [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/adult]adult[/url] of ages 40 to 65.

Note that this trait only signifies the physical appearance of this character, and it may not reflect actual age.
name: Adult

description:
This character has the [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Human_physical_appearance]physical appearance[/url] of an [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Old_age]old person[/url] of ages 66 and higher.

Note that this trait only signifies the physical appearance of this character, and it may not reflect actual age.
name: Old

description: This character has a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mesomorphic]mesomorphic[/url] body type characterized by medium bones, solid torso, low fat levels, wide shoulders with a narrow waist; usually referred to as muscular.
name: Muscular

description: This character has an [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Somatotype]endomorphic[/url] body type characterized by increased fat storage, a wide waist and a large bone structure, usually referred to as fat.
name: Overweight

description:
This character is a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gigantism]giant[/url] compared to regular humans.

Only use for characters that are beyond being overweight and/or tall by a significant amount.
name: Giant

description:
This character has a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Human_height]short physical stature[/url].

As a guideline, we decided to list characters with a height of 1.45m and below as short.
name: Short (obsolete)

description:
This character has a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Human_height]long physical stature[/url].

As a guideline, we decided to list characters with a height of 1.80m and higher as tall.
name: Tall (obsolete)

description:
This character has an [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Olive_skin]olive skin tone[/url].

This is used to describe a character with a naturally tan-colored skin tone, darker than the typical anime character but not quite brown.
name: Olive

description: This character has a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dark_skin#Dark_skin]dark skin tone[/url].
name: Dark

description: This character has a skin color and/or tone that is not found on humans normally.
name: Unnatural Skin Tone

description:
This character has a visible [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tattoo]tattoo[/url].

A tattoo is a marking made by inserting indelible ink into the dermis layer of the skin to change the pigment for decorative or other reasons. Tattoos on humans are a type of decorative body modification, while tattoos on animals are most commonly used for identification or branding.
name: Tattoo

description:
This character has a visible [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Scar]scar[/url].

A scar results from the biologic process of wound repair in the skin and other tissues of the body. Thus, scarring is a natural part of the healing process. With the exception of very minor lesions, every wound (e.g. after accident, disease, or surgery) results in some degree of scarring. An exception to this is animals with regeneration, which do not form scars and the tissue will grow back exactly as before.
name: Scar

description:
This character wears an [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Apron]apron[/url].

An apron is an outer protective garment that covers primarily the front of the body.
name: Apron

description:
This character wears a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Catsuit]catsuit[/url].

A catsuit is a close-fitting one-piece garment that covers the torso and the legs, and frequently the arms.

Catsuits, which date from at least the 1940s, can be worn by both men and women, and, despite the name, do not generally have feline characteristics.
name: Catsuit

description:
This character wears a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Coat_%28clothing%29]coat[/url].

A coat is a long garment worn by both men and women, for warmth or fashion. Coats typically have long sleeves and open down the front, closing by means of buttons, zippers, hook-and-loop fasteners, toggles, a belt, or a combination of these. Other possible ornaments include collars and shoulder straps.
name: Coat

description:
This character wears a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Raincoat]rain coat[/url].

A raincoat is a waterproof or water-resistant coat worn to protect the body from rain. The term rain jacket is sometimes used to refer to raincoats that are waist length. A rain jacket may be combined with a pair of rain pants to make a rain suit.
name: Rain Coat

description:
This character wears a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Trenchcoat]trench coat[/url].

A trench coat or trenchcoat is a raincoat made of waterproof heavy-duty cotton drill or poplin, wool gabardine, or leather. It generally has a removable insulated lining; and it is usually knee-length.
name: Trench Coat

description:
This character wears a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dress]dress[/url].

A dress is a garment consisting of a skirt with an attached bodice (or a matching bodice giving the effect of a one-piece garment).
name: Dress

description:
This character wears a mini-dress.

A mini-dress is a very short dress, at least 10 cm above the knee.
name: Mini-dress

description:
This character wears a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Robe]robe[/url].
A robe is a loose-fitting outer garment. A robe is distinguished from a cape or cloak by the fact that it usually has sleeves.
name: Robe

description:
This character wears a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Keikogi]keikogi[/url].

Keikogi is a uniform for training, used in martial arts derived from Japan, or budou. The top part of the keikogi is called the uwagi. The pants of the keikogi are called zubon, which is the Japanese word for pants or trousers.
name: Keikogi

description:
This character wears a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kimono]kimono[/url].

Kimonos are T-shaped, straight-lined robes worn so that the hem falls to the ankle, with attached collars and long, wide sleeves. Kimonos are wrapped around the body, always with the left side over the right (except when dressing the dead for burial), and secured by a sash called an obi, which is tied at the back. Kimonos are generally worn with traditional footwear (especially zouri or geta) and split-toe socks (tabi).
name: Kimono

description:
This character wears [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pajamas]pajamas[/url].

Pajamas may refer to several garments, for both daywear and nightwear, derived from traditional pajamas and involving variations of style and material.
name: Pajamas

description:
This character wears a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Suit_%28clothing%29]suit[/url].

In clothing, a suit is a set of garments made from the same cloth, consisting of at least a jacket and trousers.
name: Suit

description:
These are the traits for the characters' [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Headwear]headgear[/url].

Headgear, headwear or headdress is the name given to any element of clothing which is worn on one's head.
name: Headwear

description:
This character wears an [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Earring]earring[/url].

Earrings are jewelry attached to the ear through a piercing in the earlobe or some other external part of the ear (except in the case of clip earrings, which clip onto the lobe).
name: Earrings

description:
This character wears [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Glasses]glasses[/url].

Glasses are frames bearing lenses worn in front of the eyes, normally for vision correction or eye protection.
name: Glasses

description:
This character wears a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hat]hat[/url].

A hat is a head covering used for several reasons. It may be worn for protection against the elements, for ceremonial or religious reasons, for safety, or as a fashion accessory.
name: Hat

description:
This character wears a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ushanka]ushanka[/url].

An ushanka is a Russian fur cap with ear flaps that can be tied up to the crown of the cap, or tied at the chin to protect the ears, jaw and lower chin from the cold. The thick dense fur also offers some protection against blunt impacts to the head.
name: Ushanka

description:
This character wears a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hood_%28headgear%29]hood[/url].

A hood is a kind of headgear that covers most of the head and neck and sometimes the face.
name: Hood

description:
This character wears a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mask]mask[/url].

A mask is an article normally worn on the face, typically for protection, disguise, performance or entertainment.
name: Mask

description:
This character wears a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ribbon#Cloth_ribbon]ribbon[/url] on his/her hair.

A ribbon or riband is a thin band of flexible material, typically cloth but also plastic or sometimes metal, used primarily for binding and tying. In this case, a cloth or plastic ribbon is used on hair either as a decoration or to tie the hair.
name: Hair Ribbon

description:
This character wears a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Headband]headband[/url].

A headband is a clothing accessory worn in the hair or around the forehead, usually to hold hair away from the face or eyes. Headbands generally consist of a loop of elastic material or a horseshoe-shaped piece of flexible plastic or metal.
name: Headband

description:
This character wears a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Headband]headband[/url] with animal ears.

A headband is a clothing accessory worn in the hair or around the forehead, usually to hold hair away from the face or eyes. Headbands generally consist of a loop of elastic material or a horseshoe-shaped piece of flexible plastic or metal.

Kemonomimi, literally meaning "animal ears", is based on the the concept of drawing animals as bishoujo or having bishoujo wear or have animal accessories (such as ears or tails). Catgirls are the most prolific in this category, although bunnygirls, foxgirls, and dog girls are also common.

Kemonomimi characters typically appear human except for added animal-like qualities.

This trait is intended for characters wearing head accessories animal ears. And it should not be mixed with the other two kemonomimi traits:
Hair > [url=http://vndb.org/i31]Kemonomimi[/url] refers to hair styles that look like animal ears and
Body > [url=http://vndb.org/i677]Kemonomimi[/url] refers to humanoid characters with actual animal ears.
name: Kemonomimi Headband

description:
This character acts [url=http://dictionary.reference.com/browse/secretive]secretive[/url].

A secretive character is keeping an important secret, hiding something from the rest of the characters.

Based on the character he/she might not mind keeping it at all. But he/she might also be under great stress either due to worry that the secret will get out or might be battling the desire to tell it and be free.
name: Secretive

description:
This character wears a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jacket]jacket[/url].

A jacket is a type of sleeved hip- or waist-length garment for the upper body. Copared to a coat, a jacket is generally shorter, ending just below the waist, and often lighter.
name: Jacket

description:
This character wears a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Scarf]scarf[/url].

A scarf is a piece of fabric worn around the neck, or near the head or around the waist for warmth, cleanliness, fashion or for religious reasons.
name: Scarf

description:
This character wears a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Necktie]necktie[/url].

The necktie (or tie) is a long piece of cloth worn for decorative purposes around the neck or shoulders, resting under the shirt collar and knotted at the throat.
name: Necktie

description:
This character wears a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Necklace]necklace[/url].

A necklace is an article of jewellery which is worn around the neck.
name: Necklace

description:
This character wears a necklace with [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Christian_cross]christian cross[/url].

The Christian cross, seen as a representation of the instrument of the crucifixion of Jesus Christ, is the best-known religious symbol of Christianity. It is related to the crucifix (a cross that includes a usually three-dimensional representation of Jesus' body) and to the more general family of cross symbols.
name: Cross Necklace

description:
This character wears a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Shirt]shirt[/url].

A shirt is a a catch-all term for a broad variety of upper-body garments and undergarments.
name: Shirt

description:
This character wears a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cardigan_%28sweater%29]cardigan[/url].

A cardigan is a type of machine- or hand-knitted sweater that ties, buttons or zips down the front; by contrast, a pullover does not open in front but must be "pulled over" the head to be worn.
name: Cardigan

description:
This character wears a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/T-shirt]t-shirt[/url].

A T-shirt is a shirt which is pulled on over the head to cover most of a person's torso. A T-shirt is usually buttonless and collarless, with a round neck and short sleeves.
name: T-shirt

description:
This character wears a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vest]vest[/url].

A vest is a sleeveless upper-body garment worn over a dress shirt and necktie (if applicable) and below a coat as a part of most men's formal wear, and as the third piece of the three-piece male business suit.
name: Vest

description:
This character wears a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wristband]wristband[/url].

Wristbands are encircling strips worn on the wrist, made of any of a variety of materials depending on the purpose. The term can be used to refer to the bracelet-like band of a wristwatch, to the cuff or other part of a sleeve that covers the wrist, or to decorative or functional bands worn on the wrist for other reasons, such as lanyards.
name: Wristband

description:
This character wears a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bracer]bracer[/url].

A bracer (or arm-guard) is a strap or sheath, commonly made of leather, stone, or plastic that covers the inside of an archer's arm to protect it while shooting. Bracers keep the inside of the archer's forearm from getting hurt by the string of the bow or the fletching of the arrow; they also prevent loose clothing from catching the bow string.
name: Bracer

description:
This character wears a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cloak]cloak[/url].

A cloak is a type of loose garment that is worn over indoor clothing and serves the same purpose as an overcoat; it protects the wearer from the cold, rain or wind for example, or it may form part of a fashionable outfit or uniform.
name: Cloak

description:
This character wears [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Arm_warmer]arm warmers[/url].

Arm warmers can describe any glove-like articles of clothing that lack finger coverings and/or were originally designed to keep wrists and lower arms warm.
name: Arm Warmers

description:
This character wears [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Evening_glove]evening gloves[/url].

Ladies' evening gloves or opera gloves are a type of formal glove that reaches beyond the elbow.
name: Evening Gloves

description:
This character wears [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gloves]gloves[/url].

A glove is a garment covering the hand.
name: Gloves

description:
This character wears [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gauntlet_%28glove%29]gauntlets[/url].

Gauntlet is a name for several different styles of glove, particularly those with an extended cuff covering part of the forearm.
name: Gauntlet

description:
This character wears a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hakama]hakama[/url].

Hakama are a type of traditional Japanese clothing. Hakama are tied at the waist and fall approximately to the ankles. There are two types of hakama, undivided andon bakama and umanori type with divided legs, both appear similar outside.
name: Hakama

description:
This character wears a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Skirt]skirt[/url].

A skirt is a tube- or cone-shaped garment that hangs from the waist and covers all or part of the legs.
name: Skirt

description:
This character wears a half-skirt.

A half-skirt is a kind of skirt that is missing a vertical half. So it can only cover one leg or just buttocks like the garments worn by middle age knights.
name: Half-Skirt

description:
This character wears a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Miniskirt]miniskirt[/url].

A miniskirt is a skirt with a hemline well above the knees – generally no longer than 10 cm below the buttocks.
name: Miniskirt

description:
This character wears [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jeans]jeans[/url].

Jeans are trousers made from denim. Starting in the 1950s, jeans, originally designed for working people, became popular among teenagers. They come in many styles and colors; however, "blue jeans" are particularly identified with American culture, especially the American Old West.
name: Jeans

description:
This character wears [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Shorts]shorts[/url].

Shorts are a bifurcated garment worn by both men and women over their pelvic area, circling the waist, and covering the upper part of the legs, sometimes extending down to or even below the knee, but not covering the entire length of the leg, either as outer or undergarment, which makes them comfortable and easy to wear. They are called "shorts" because they are a shortened version of trousers, which cover the entire leg.
name: Shorts

description:
This character wears [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gym_shorts]gym shorts[/url].

Gym shorts are an article of clothing typical worn by people when exercising. They are typically made out of fabrics that allow for maximum comfort and ease.
name: Gym Shorts

description:
This character wears sport [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bloomers_%28clothing%29#Bloomers_in_Japan]bloomers[/url].

Bloomers are a type of girl's gym shorts in Japan.

Please do NOT use this trait for the classic (as in mid-19th century to early 20th century) bloomers. Use the [url=http://vndb.org/i1263]Traditional Bloomers[/url] trait instead.
name: Sport Bloomers

description:
This character wears [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Boot]boots[/url].

A boot is a type of footwear. Most boots mainly cover the foot and the ankle and extend up the leg, sometimes as far as the knee or even the hip. Most boots have a heel that is clearly distinguishable from the rest of the sole, even if the two are made of one piece.
name: Boots

description:
This character wears [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kinky_boots]thigh-high boots[/url].

Thigh-high Boots are boots with extreme characteristics which are intended to present a dramatic sexy appearance, such as by a prostitute or dominatrix. Extreme characteristics might include very high heels, thigh- or crotch-high length, or unusual colors or materials.
name: Thigh-high Boots

description:
This character wears [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sports_shoes]sports shoes[/url].

A sports shoe is a generic name for the footwear primarily designed for sports or other forms of physical exercise but in recent years has come to be used for casual everyday activities.
name: Sports Shoes

description:
These are the traits for characters' [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Socks]socks[/url].

A sock is an item of clothing worn on the feet.
name: Socks

description:
This character wears [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Knee_highs]knee-highs[/url].

Knee-highs are hosiery that covers the feet and legs almost up to the knee.

[url=https://s.vndb.org/sf/43/79743.jpg]Example[/url]
name: Knee-high Socks

description:
This character wears [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pantyhose]pantyhose[/url].

Pantyhose are sheer, close-fitting legwear, covering the body from the waist to the feet.
name: Pantyhose

description:
This rait groups the traits for socks (or stockings) that reach higher than the knee, but not higher than the waist. Please use the specific child traits instead if applicable.

A [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Stocking]stocking[/url] is a close-fitting, variously elastic garment covering the foot and part of the leg. In American and Australian English it is also a synonym for pantyhose.
name: Stockings

description:
This character wears [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Thigh-high_stockings]thigh-highs[/url].

Hold-ups or stay-ups (in the USA also referred to as thigh-highs) are stockings with a band of elastic sewn to the top, designed to hold the stockings up when worn, without the need for a garter belt or garters.

If the stockings are held up with a garter belt, use [url=https://vndb.org/i607]Garter Belt[/url] instead of this trait.
name: Thigh-high Stockings

description:
This character wears [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Personal_armour]armor[/url].

Personal armor is the whole of protecting clothing, designed to absorb and/or deflect slashing, bludgeoning, and penetrating attacks.
name: Armor

description:
This character wears [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mail_%28armour%29]mail armor[/url].

Mail or chain mail is a type of armour consisting of small metal rings linked together in a pattern to form a mesh.
name: Mail Armor

description:
This character wears [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Plate_armour]plate armor[/url].

Plate armour, plate armor or plate mail is personal armour made from large metal plates, worn on the chest and sometimes the entire body.
name: Plate Armor

description:
This character wears a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ballistic_vest]bulletproof vest[/url].

A bulletproof vest is an item of personal armor that helps absorb the impact from firearm-fired projectiles and shrapnel from explosions, and is worn on the torso.
name: Kevlar Armor

description:
This character wears a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Power_armor]power armor[/url].

A powered exoskeleton, also known as powered armour is a powered mobile machine consisting primarily of an exoskeleton-like framework worn by a person and a power supply that supplies at least part of the activation-energy for limb movement.

The types of armor that are more of a vehicle than a set of armored clothing like [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mecha]mecha[/url] are exluded from this trait.
name: Power Armor

description:
This character's body is partially clothed.

Usually used to refer to characters not wearing any clothes above waistline, like a man only wearing jeans, but can also be used for the other way around.

This trait refers to characters walking around dressed in this sense, other than the times of changing clothes, undressing or having sex.
name: Half-naked

description:
This character wears a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bandages]bandage[/url].

A bandage is a piece of material used either to support a medical device such as a dressing or splint, or on its own to provide support to the body. Bandages are available in a wide range of types, from generic cloth strips, to specialised shaped bandages designed for a specific limb or part of the body, although bandages can often be improvised as the situation demands, using clothing, blankets or other material.
name: Bandages

description: These are the traits for clothing with a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Religious]religious[/url] signifiance.
name: Religious Clothing and Accessories

description: These are the traits for clothing with a signifiance in [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Christianity]christianity[/url].
name: Christianity

description:
This character wears [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Clergy_shirt]clerical clothing[/url].

Collarino is probably the most common type of shirt and collar among Roman Catholic clergy. It resembles a standard dress shirt, but has a standing black collar that is sewn to accommodate a white cloth or soft plastic insert, leaving a small white square at the base of the throat.
name: Collarino

description: These are the clothing tags that don't come up with where they are worn but with other aspects.
name: Accessories and Others

description:
This character has an [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Axe]axe[/url].

The axe, or ax, is an implement that has been used for millennia to shape, split and cut wood; to harvest timber; as a weapon; and as a ceremonial or heraldic symbol. The axe has many forms and specialized uses but generally consists of an axe head with a handle, or helve.
name: Axe

description:
This character has a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bow_%28weapon%29]bow[/url].

A bow is a weapon that projects arrows by its elasticity. Essentially, it is a form of spring. As the bow is drawn, energy is stored in the limbs of the bow and transformed into rapid motion when the string is released, with the string transferring this force to the arrow.
name: Bow

description:
This character has a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chain_weapon]chain weapon[/url].

A chain weapon is a weapon made of one or more heavy object attached to a chain, sometimes with a handle.
name: Chain Weapon

description:
This character has a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Knife]knife[/url].

A knife is any cutting edge or blade, hand-held or otherwise, with or without a handle. Use this trait for fixed blade knives.
name: Knife

description:
This character has a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pocket_knife]pocket knife[/url].

A pocketknife is a folding knife with one or more blades that fit inside the handle that can still fit in a pocket. A larger folding knife or pocket knife is also known as a jackknife or jack-knife. Blades can range from 1 cm to as much as 30 cm in length, but a more typical blade length is 5 to 15 cm.
name: Pocket Knife

description:
This character has a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Throwing_knife]throwing knife[/url].

Throwing knives are knives that are specially designed and weighted so that they can be thrown effectively. They are commonly made of a single piece of steel or other material, without handles, unlike other types of knives. The knife has two sections, the "blade" which is the sharpened half of the knife and the "grip" which is not sharpened. The purpose of the grip is to allow the knife to be safely handled by the user and also to balance the weight of the blade.
name: Throwing Knife

description:
This character carries a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dagger]dagger[/url].

A dagger is a double-edged blade used for hitting, stabbing or thrusting. They often fulfill the role of a secondary defense weapon in close combat.
name: Dagger

description:
This character has a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Spear]spear[/url].

A spear is a pole weapon consisting of a shaft, usually of wood, with a pointed head.
name: Spear

description:
This character has a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lance]lance[/url].

A lance is a pole weapon or spear designed to be used by a mounted warrior. The lance is longer, stouter and heavier than an infantry spear, and unsuited for throwing, or for the rapid thrusting.
name: Lance

description:
This character has a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Katana]katana[/url].

The katana is characterized by its distinctive appearance: a curved, slender, single edged blade with a length of greater than 60 cm, circular or squared guard, and long grip to accommodate two hands. It has historically been associated with the samurai of feudal Japan, and has become renowned for its sharpness and cutting ability.
name: Katana

description:
This character has a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/No-dachi]no-dachi[/url].

A nodachi is a large two-handed Japanese sword carried by foot soldiers and was designed as a weapon for war versus cavalry and open field engagements. The length of the nodachi's hilt varied between 30 to 33 centimeters. The blade was usually around 122 centimeters long. Its cutting capability and range exceeded that of a katana, due to its weight and size.
name: No-dachi

description:
This character has a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Long_sword]longsword[/url].

The longsword is a type of European sword used during the late medieval period, approximately 1350 to 1550. Longswords have long cruciform hilts with grips over 10 to 15 cm length (providing room for two hands). Straight double-edged blades are often over 1 m to 1.2 m length, and weigh typically between 1.2 and 2.4 kg, with light specimens just below 1 kg, and heavy specimens just above 2 kg.
name: Longsword

description:
This character has a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Walking-stick]walking stick[/url].

A walking stick is a device used by many people to facilitate balancing while walking. Some kinds of walking stick may be used by people with disabilities as a crutch.

The walking stick has also historically been known to be used as a defensive or offensive weapon, and may conceal a knife or sword as in a swordstick.
name: Walking Stick

description:
This character has a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Firearms]firearm[/url].

A firearm is a weapon which projects either single or multiple projectiles at high velocity through rapid, confined burning of a propellant.
name: Firearms

description:
This character has a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Handgun]handgun[/url].

A handgun is a firearm designed to be held and operated by one hand. This characteristic differentiates handguns as a general class of firearms from long guns such as rifles and shotguns (which are mounted against the shoulder).
name: Handgun

description:
This character has a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rifle]rifle[/url].

A rifle is a firearm designed to be fired from the shoulder, with a barrel that has a helical groove or pattern of grooves ("rifling") cut into the barrel walls.
name: Rifle

description:
This character has a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Shotgun]shotgun[/url].

A shotgun is a firearm that is usually designed to be fired from the shoulder, which uses the energy of a fixed shell to fire a number of small spherical pellets called shot, or a solid projectile called a slug.
name: Shotgun

description:
This character has a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Submachine_gun]submachine gun[/url].

A submachine gun is an automatic carbine, designed to fire pistol cartridges. It combines the automatic fire of a machine gun with the cartridge of a pistol. An assault rifle, in contrast, uses an intermediate-power cartridge with more power than a pistol but less than a standard rifle or battle rifle.
name: Submachine Gun

description:
This character is Hetare which is the opposite of [url=/i74]Proactive[/url].

This character is a worthless, spineless, undependable, lazy, inept and no help to anyone and most of the time unable to make any decisions in time.

This character is always being pushed around by every other characters in the game at the very start and they are still like that in the final moments of the game. They make other characters help them everytime before facing their own problems.

Please don't use this trait on games that have this character starting this way but also has him fixing his ways in the first hours of the game. Thus making it somewhat bearable by some quick reading.
While this description says man, this trait can also be applied to worthless, spineless, good for nothing female characters.
name: Hetare

description:
This character is a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tsundere]tsundere[/url].

Tsundere is a Japanese character development process which describes a person who is initially cold and even hostile towards another person before gradually showing their warm side over time.
name: Tsundere

description:
This character is a modern [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tsundere]tsundere[/url] with two personalities, hostile and lovestruck.

A variation of the tsundere personality type which has the tsundere character switch between hostile and lovestruck personalities often, which is in contrast to the classic tsundere type where the change is gradual and permanent.
name: Modern Tsundere

description:
This character is a mayadere, a deadly dangerous tsundere.

A mayadere usually starts as an antagonist trying to kill the someone but switches sides after falling in love. This character is unpredictable and dangerous for everyone including the romantic interest.
name: Mayadere

description:
This character is a coodere, starts uninterested but turns lovestruck later.

A coodere starts cold, distant, uninterested and doesn't pay any attention to  potential love interests, but eventually turns lovestruck. Unlike the classic type, a coodere doesn't get hostile with the other characters, but just ignores them.
name: Coodere

description:
This character is a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yandere#Y]yandere[/url].

Yandere is a Japanese term for a person who is initially very loving and gentle to someone before their devotion becomes destructive in nature, often through violence. Yandere characters are mentally unstable, often using extreme violence as an outlet for their emotions.

Unlike Yangire characters, yandere characters' actions are motivated by love.
name: Yandere

description:
This character is a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yandere#Y]yangire[/url].

Yangire is used to describe a character who is mentally ill and snaps instantly without showing affection for the victim of their outbursts.

Just like yandere characters, yangire characters star very loving and gentle, and suddenly turn out violent, but the difference is that yangire characters' actions are not related to romantic feelings.
name: Yangire

description:
This character is an [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Otaku]otaku[/url].

Otaku is a Japanese term used to refer to people with obsessive interests, particularly anime, manga, or video games.
name: Otaku

description:
This character is a deredere, lovestruck from the begining of the story.

Deredere characters are deeply in love with someone from the begining or early parts of the story and this is the centerpoint of all of their actions.
name: Deredere

description: These are the traits about notable talking patterns that make this character stand out.
name: Talking Patterns

description: These characters use "boku", one of the [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Japanese_pronoun]Japanese pronouns[/url] for "I", to address themselves.
name: Boku

description: These characters use "ore", one of the [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Japanese_pronoun]Japanese pronouns[/url] for "I", to address themselves.
name: Ore

description:
This character sometimes acts like a  [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Foolishness]fool[/url].

Foolishness is the lack of wisdom. In this sense it differs from stupidity, which is the lack of intelligence.
name: Airhead

description:
This character is a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Laziness]lazy[/url] person.

Laziness (also called indolence) is a disinclination to activity or exertion despite having the ability to do so.
name: Lazy

description:
This character sometimes acts like an  [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Idiot]idiot[/url].

An idiot is a mentally deficient person, or someone who acts in a self-defeating or significantly counterproductive way.
name: Idiot

description:
This character's mind is usually occupied by sexual thoughts.

Perverted characters think about sex all the time and they would do anything to get close to things that they consider erotic.
name: Pervert

description:
This character can't make a decision between romantic interests.

Romantically indecisive characters are unsure about whom they love more and are afraid to hurt the one that would get left behind. While trying to not to hurt anyone, they cause immense grief to any parties involved.
name: Romantically Indecisive

description:
This character knows a lot about the situation, just not personally.
 
Genre savvy characters may be unfamiliar with their current situation, never experienced it before, but they certainly did read a story, saw a movie or played a game about "just the same thing". They would try to use these "experiences" to their advantage at every opportunity.
name: Genre Savvy

description:
This character doesn't display any kinds of emotions outside.

Stoic characters act like they don't have feelings, except in very rare moments, when they talk or act no emotional expressions appear on their faces nor can be noticed from their movements.

This doesn't mean these characters don't feel anything, but that they don't show any outside. They can have psychological problems resulting in this behavior or may have an another reason to act this way.
name: Stoic

description:
This character is or seems [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ignorance]ignorant[/url] and lacking [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Common_sense]common sense[/url].

Ignorant characters are unaware of most things that are considered common knowledge by regular people. It is not because they are incapable of learning, but usually because they just never got the chance to learn or didn't try.

They don't understand the things that are considered obvious by most people because their thought process is different doesn't usually end with the same results with others.

Their actions might seem stupid, meaningless and outright wrong, but that doesn't mean that they are stupid, cruel or evil, they are usually just different.

An ignorant character may be from a distant place or time or maybe he/she just got out of prison, or returned from a prolonged conflict.

An ignorant character is different from an uneducated one since it is not about education. Though a character may carry both of the traits.
name: Ignorant

description:
This character had little to no [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Education]education[/url].

Uneducated characters never had much experience with schools or private tutors and they don't have any knowledge of any of the subjects thought in one, like mathematics, science and history. At worst case an uneducated character may not even know how to read or write.

An uneducated character is different from an ignorrant one since it is not about common knowledge. Though a character may carry both of the traits.
name: Uneducated

description:
This character is a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hunter]hunter[/url].

Hunting is the practice of pursuing any living thing (usually wildlife) for food, recreation, or trade. In present-day use, the term refers to lawful hunting, as distinguished from poaching, which is the killing, trapping or capture of the hunted species contrary to applicable law. The species which are hunted are referred to as game and are usually mammals and migratory or non-migratory gamebirds.

Fictional hunters on the other hand are known to hunt anything from animals to humans to monsters...
name: Hunter

description:
This character is faking his or her personality.

Pretending characters hide their true personality and act like someone else. They may be acting this way because of social pressure or out of a hidden agenda.

This trait is intended for characters that are pretending all or most of their personality, do not use it for ones that pretend one or two things in a game.
name: Pretending

description:
This character suffers from [url=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hypersexuality]hypersexuality or nymphomania[/url].

Hypersexuality, or excessive sexual drive, are medical terms for a desire to engage in sexual activities at a level that is considered abnormally high in relation to normal development or culture and at a level that causes distress or serious problems for the person affected or to persons associated with them.
name: Nymphomania

description:
