Activities such as card games and board games, are classified as "mind sports" and some are recognized as Olympic sports, requiring primarily mental skills and mental physical involvement.

Non-competitive activities, for example as jogging or playing catch are usually classified as forms of recreation. Though you should still use these traits for characters if they practice them even if not in the form of a sport.

Please make a specific trait for the type of sport that characters engage in and use this trait only if that sport is unknown or does not exists in the real world.
name: Sports

description:
This character practices [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Archery]archery[/url].

Archery is the art, practice, or skill of propelling arrows with the use of a bow, from 'arcus' (Latin). Archery has historically been used for hunting and combat; in modern times, however, its main use is that of a recreational activity.
name: Archery

description:
This character plays [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Baseball]baseball[/url].

Baseball is a bat-and-ball sport played between two teams of nine players each. The goal is to score runs by hitting a thrown ball with a bat and touching a series of four bases arranged at the corners of a ninety-foot square, or diamond.

Players on one team (the batting team) take turns hitting against the pitcher of the other team (the fielding team), which tries to stop them from scoring runs by getting hitters out in any of several ways. A player on the batting team can stop at any of the bases and later advance via a teammate's hit or other means. The teams switch between batting and fielding whenever the fielding team records three outs. One turn at bat for each team constitutes an inning and nine innings make up a professional game. The team with the most runs at the end of the game wins.
name: Baseball

description:
This character is [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Blindness]blind[/url].

Blindness is the condition of lacking visual perception due to physiological or neurological factors.
name: Blindness

description:
This character is [url=http://www.thefreedictionary.com/arrogant]arrogant[/url].

Arrogant characters have or display a sense of overbearing self-worth or self-importance. They are marked by or arising from a feeling or assumption of their superiority toward others.
name: Arrogant

description:
This character is [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Altruism]altruistic[/url].

Altruism is selfless concern for the welfare of others. It is a traditional virtue in many cultures, and a core aspect of various religious traditions, though the concept of 'others' toward whom concern should be directed can vary among religions.

Altruism is the opposite of selfishness.
name: Altruistic

description:
This character is a [url=http://dictionary.reference.com/browse/Schoolmate]schoolmate[/url] of another character in this story.

A schoolmate is someone that you go to the same school with.
name: Schoolmate

description:
This character is a [url=http://dictionary.reference.com/browse/Classmate]classmate[/url] of another character in this story.

A classmate is someone that you go to the same school and same class for one or more periods.
name: Classmate

description:
This character is a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sempai]senpai[/url] of another character in this story.

Senpai literally mean "senior", and usually refers to the member of higher hierarchy in one's occupation, often indicated by longer service or older age. Some examples can be a senior at a work place or a student of a class some years above. This trait is also specifically intended for characters who are called senpai throughout the story.
name: Senpai

description:
This character is a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sempai]kouhai[/url] of another character in this story.

Kouhai literally mean "junior", and usually refers to the member of lower hierarchy in one's occupation, often indicated by shorter service or younger age. Some examples can be a junior at a work place or a student of a class some years below. This trait is also specifically intended for characters who are called kouhai throughout the story.
name: Kouhai

description:
This character is a [url=http://dictionary.reference.com/browse/coworker]coworker[/url] of another character in this story.

A coworker is someone that you work together with at the same company/office.
name: Coworker

description:
This character is a [url=http://dictionary.reference.com/browse/coworker]neighbour[/url] of another character in this story.

A neighbor is someone that lives nearby. Someone from the same [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Neighbour]neighbourhood[/url].
name: Neighbor

description:
This character is a [url=http://www.thefreedictionary.com/teammate]teammate[/url] of another character in this story.

A teammate is a fellow member of a team that you are a part of.
name: Teammate

description:
This character wears a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Belt_%28clothing%29]belt[/url].

A belt is a flexible band or strap, typically made of leather or heavy cloth, and worn around the waist. A belt supports trousers or other articles of clothing.

This trait is intended for characters that are actually seen wearing a belt, don't add it to anyone that is seen wearing a piece of clothing that is normally worn with a belt (like trousers) and add this tag too unless the belt is also seen or mentioned.
name: Belt

description:
This character suffers from a severe case of [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Headache]headache[/url].

A headache is pain anywhere in the region of the head or neck.

It can be a symptom of a number of different conditions of the head and neck. The brain tissue itself is not sensitive to pain because it lacks pain receptors. Rather, the pain is caused by disturbance of the pain-sensitive structures around the brain.
name: Headache

description:
This character is wearing a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hoodie]hoodie[/url].

A hoodie is a sweatshirt with a hood. The characteristic design includes large frontal pockets, a hood, and (usually) a drawstring to adjust the hood opening. They are sometimes worn with sweatpants.

Some hoodies have zippers on them to allow easy removal much like a jacket. These hoodies are sometimes called zip-up hoodies.
name: Hoodie

description:
This character is [url=http://dictionary.reference.com/browse/timid]timid[/url]. A timid character is someone who is lacking in courage or confidence in everyday interactions.

They usually will face the challange if there are enough reasons to do so (like saving their friend, or won't watch any scary movie if it's not a popular film that will help them to blend in with others), but they scare themselves to death when facing the thing. Popular example would be [url=/c51035]Niimi Sora[/url].
name: Timid

description:
This character wears a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Qipao]chinese dress[/url].

The cheongsam is a body-hugging (modified in Shanghai) one-piece Chinese dress for women; the male version is the changshan.

The stylish and often tight-fitting cheongsam that is most often associated with today was created in the 1920s in Shanghai and was made fashionable by socialites and upperclass women.
name: Chinese Dress

description:
This character wears a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Shawl]shawl[/url].

A shawl is a simple item of clothing, loosely worn over the shoulders, upper body and arms, sometimes also over the head.

It is usually a rectangular or square piece of cloth, that is often folded to make a triangle but can also be triangular in shape. Other shapes include oblong shawls.
name: Shawl

description:
These are the traits about the [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Footwear]footwear[/url] characters are seen wearing.

Footwear consists of garments worn on the feet, for fashion, protection against the environment, and adornment.
name: Footwear

description:
This character wears [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sandal_%28footwear%29]sandals[/url].

Sandals are an open type of outdoor footwear, consisting of a sole held to the wearer's foot by straps or thongs passing over the instep and generally, but not always, around the ankle.

While the distinction between sandals and other types of footwear can sometimes be blurry (as in the case of huaraches—the woven leather footwear seen in Mexico), the common understanding is that a sandal leaves most or all of the foot exposed.
name: Sandals

description:
This character is an [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Artificial_intelligence]artificial intelligence[/url].

Artificial intelligence is the intelligence of machines and the branch of computer science that aims to create it.

AI textbooks define the field as "the study and design of intelligent agents" where an intelligent agent is a system that perceives its environment and takes actions that maximize its chances of success.
name: Artificial Intelligence

description:
This character is a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Robot]robot[/url].

A robot is a mechanical intelligent agent which can perform tasks on its own, or with guidance. The term robot can also apply to a virtual agent. In practice it is usually an electro-mechanical machine which is guided by computer or electronic programming.

This trait is intended for mechanical machine bodies with artificial intelligences and should not be mixed with cyborgs which are part human part machine.
name: Robot

description:
This character is a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cyborg]cyborg[/url].

A cyborg is a being with both biological and artificial (e.g. electronic, mechanical or robotic) parts.

Fictional cyborgs are portrayed as a synthesis of organic and synthetic parts, and frequently pose the question of difference between human and machine as one concerned with morality, free will, and empathy.

Real cyborgs are more frequently people who use cybernetic technology to repair or overcome the physical and mental constraints of their bodies.
name: Cyborg

description:
This character is a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Guide]guide[/url].

A guide is a person who leads anyone through unknown or unmapped country. This includes a guide of the real world (such as someone who conducts travellers and tourists through a place of interest), as well as a person who leads someone to more abstract places (such as to knowledge or wisdom).
name: Guide

description:
This character suffers from a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mental_disorder]mental disorder[/url].

A mental disorder is a psychological or behavioral pattern generally associated with subjective distress or disability that occurs in an individual, and which is not a part of normal development or culture. 

A few mental disorders are diagnosed based on the harm to others, regardless of the subject's perception of distress. Over a third of people in most countries report meeting criteria for the major categories at some point in their lives.
name: Mental Affliction

description:
This character is [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Infection]infected[/url] with a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Virus]virus[/url].

An infection is the colonization of a host organism by parasite species. Infecting parasites seek to use the host's resources to reproduce, often resulting in disease.

A virus is a small infectious agent that can replicate only inside the living cells of organisms. Most viruses are too small to be seen directly with a light microscope.
name: Viral Infection

description:
These are the traits for the notable [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fashion]fashion styles[/url] that character's clothing belong to.

Fashion, a general term for a currently popular style or practice, especially in clothing, foot wear or accessories. Fashion references to anything that is the current trend in look and dress up of a person.
name: Fashion

description:
This character is dressed in [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gothic_fashion]gothic fashion[/url].

Gothic fashion is a clothing style worn by members of the Goth subculture; a dark, sometimes morbid, eroticized fashion and style of dress.

Typical Gothic fashion includes dyed black hair, black lips and black clothes. Both male and female goths wear dark eyeliner and dark fingernails.

Styles are often borrowed from the Punks, Victorians and Elizabethans. BDSM imagery and paraphernalia are also common.
name: Gothic

description:
This character is [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cautiousness]cautious[/url].

Cautious characters are on their guard, acting with caution and watching their surroundings with alertness.

Aside from the people that are required to be cautious as a part of their jobs, like guards or military personnel, it is also noticed in the behaviors of people that have been in prolonged conflicts or dangerous environments.
name: Cautious

description:
This character is [url=http://dictionary.reference.com/browse/distrustful]distrustful[/url].

Distrustful characters are unable or unwilling to trust, doubtful and suspicious of others.

Being suspicious of everyone else usually results from a previous trauma or similar event.
name: Distrustful

description:
This character is [url=http://dictionary.reference.com/browse/Coldhearted]cold-hearted[/url].

Cold-hearted characters act in a way that is lacking sympathy or feeling. They are usually indifferent to the plight of others and unkind.
name: Cold-hearted

description:
This character is [url=http://dictionary.reference.com/browse/short-tempered]short-tempered[/url].

A short-tempered person is easily moved to anger.

[url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Angry]Anger[/url] is an emotion related to one's psychological interpretation of having been offended, wronged or denied and a tendency to undo that by retaliation.

The external expression of anger can be found in facial expressions, body language, physiological responses, and at times in public acts of aggression.
name: Short-tempered

description:
This character is [url=http://dictionary.reference.com/browse/refined]refined[/url].

Refined characters are mostly from upper class families and are  usually described as cultivated, polished, polite, courteous, civilized, courtly, genteel and elegant.
name: Refined

description:
This character is [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wealth]wealthy[/url].

Wealth is the abundance of valuable resources or material possessions, or the control of such assets. An individual, community, region or country that possesses an abundance of such possessions or resources is known as wealthy.
name: Wealthy

description:
This character is [url=http://dictionary.reference.com/browse/poor]poor[/url].

Poor people have little or no money, goods, or other means of support. Some may even be [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Poverty]poverty-stricken[/url].
name: Poor

description:
This character wears a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cassock]cassock[/url].

The cassock, an item of clerical clothing, is an ankle-length robe worn by clerics of the Roman Catholic Church, Eastern Orthodox Church, Anglican Church, Lutheran Church and some ministers and ordained officers of Presbyterian and Reformed churches.

In Western Christianity the cassock is generally close-fitting, but in the Eastern Orthodox Church the outer cassock is quite loose.
name: Cassock

description:
This character uses [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Medication]prescribed[/url] medication.

Prescribed medication refers to use of drugs at set intervals and doses decided by medical professionals as a means of treatment of an illness, disease or unwanted health condition.

It differs from recreational drug use by this factor of professional guidance and legality.

This trait is intended to be used for characters that take drugs not for fun but by doctors or in some cases other authorities orders.
name: Medication

description:
This character gets held in [url=http://dictionary.reference.com/browse/confinement]confinement[/url].

Confinement is to shut or keep a person in a small closed space and prevent that person from leaving this place because of imprisonment, illness, discipline, etc.

This trait can be used for both people imprisoned by law, civil confinement for psychiatric patients and ones that are confined by others illegally, like a kidnapping.
name: Confinement

description:
This character is a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Detective]detective[/url].

A detective is an investigator, either a member of a police agency or a private person. The latter may be known as private investigators.

Informally, and primarily in fiction, a detective is any licensed or unlicensed person who solves crimes, including historical crimes, or looks into records.
name: Detective

description:
This character conducts an [url=http://dictionary.reference.com/browse/Investigation]investigation[/url].

An investigation  is a systematic, minute, and thorough attempt to learn the facts about something complex or hidden. It is often formal and official.
name: Investigation

description:
This character is seen with a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cellphone]mobile phone[/url].

A mobile phone is an electronic device used to make mobile telephone calls across a wide geographic area. Mobile phones are different from cordless telephones, which only offer telephone service within a limited range of a fixed land line, for example within a home or an office.
name: Mobile Phone

description:
This character is an [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Extraterrestrial_life]extraterrestrial[/url].

Extraterrestrial life is defined as life that does not originate from Earth.

Hypothetical forms of extraterrestrial life range from simple bacteria-like organisms to sapient beings far more advanced than humans. It is currently unknown whether any such forms of life exist or ever existed.
name: Extraterrestrial

description:
This character is a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Monster]monster[/url].

A monster is any fictional creature, usually found in legends or horror fiction, that is somewhat hideous and may produce physical harm or mental fear by either its appearance or its actions.

The word "monster" derives from Latin monstrum, an aberrant occurrence, usually biological, that was taken as a sign that something was wrong within the natural order. The word connotes something wrong or evil; a monster is generally morally objectionable, physically or psychologically hideous, and/or a freak of nature.
name: Monster

description:
This character engages in [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cannibalism]cannibalism[/url].

Cannibalism is the act or practice of humans eating the flesh of other human beings.

While the expression "cannibalism" has origins in the act of humans eating other humans, it has extended into zoology to mean the act of any animal consuming members of its own type or kind, including the consumption of mates.
name: Cannibalism

description:
This character suffers from an [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Illness]illness[/url] or [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Disease]disease[/url].

A disease or illness is an abnormal condition affecting the body of an organism. It is often construed to be a medical condition associated with specific symptoms and signs.

It may be caused by external factors, such as infectious disease, or it may be caused by internal dysfunctions, such as autoimmune diseases.

Illnesses and diseases usually affect people not only physically, but also emotionally, as contracting and living with many diseases can alter one's perspective on life, and their personality.
name: Illness

description:
This character uses a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Whip]whip[/url].

The word whip describes two basic types of tools:-

A long stick-like device, usually slightly flexible, with a small bit of leather or cord, called a "popper" or a "cracker," on the end. Depending on length and flexibility, this type is often called a riding whip, riding crop or "bat". It is also sometimes called a "horsewhip" or "horse whip".

The other type of whip is a long tapered flexible length of single-strand or plaited (braided) material (usually leather) with a stiff handle. Some whips of this type include the bullwhip and the stockwhip. Each design has many variations and lengths for different purposes, often with different names.

As well as these traditional whip types designed for use on animals, there are whip designs that had historic uses for inflicting pain on humans, such as the "cat o' nine tails", knout and others. These devices are used as flogging instruments, a means of control, corporal punishment or torture.
name: Whip

description:
This character gets [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pregnancy]pregnant[/url].

Pregnancy is the carrying of one or more offspring, known as a fetus or embryo, inside the womb of a female.

In a pregnancy, there can be multiple gestations, as in the case of twins or triplets. The World Health Organization defines normal term for delivery as between 37 weeks and 42 weeks.
name: Pregnancy

description:
This character loses a limb to [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Amputation]amputation[/url].

Amputation is the removal of a body extremity by trauma or surgery.

As a surgical measure, it is used to control pain or a disease process in the affected limb, such as malignancy or gangrene. In some cases, it is carried out on individuals as a preventative surgery for such problems. A special case is the congenital amputation, a congenital disorder, where foetal limbs have been cut off by constrictive bands.

In some countries, amputation of the hands or feet is or was used as a form of punishment for people who committed crimes. Amputation has also been used as a tactic in war and acts of terrorism; it may also occur as a war injury. In some cultures and religions, minor amputations or mutilations are considered a ritual accomplishment.

A transplant or a prosthesis are the only options for recovering the loss.
name: Amputation

description:
This character is or later becomes a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Slavery]slave[/url].

Slavery is a system under which people are treated as property and are forced to work. Slaves can be held against their will from the time of their capture, purchase or birth, and deprived of the right to leave, to refuse to work, or to demand compensation. In some historical situations it has been legal for owners to kill slaves.
name: Slavery

description:
This character is a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vampire]vampire[/url].

Vampires are mythological or folkloric beings who subsist by feeding on the life essence (generally in the form of blood) of living creatures, regardless of whether they are undead or a living person.
name: Vampire

description:
This character engages in [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Brainwashing]brainwashing[/url].

Brainwashing refers to a process in which a group or individual "systematically uses unethically manipulative methods to persuade others to conform to the wishes of the manipulator(s), often to the detriment of the person being manipulated". The term has been applied to any tactic, psychological or otherwise, which can be seen as subverting an individual's sense of control over their own thinking, behavior, emotions or decision making.
name: Mind Control

description:
This character is a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/University]university[/url] [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Student]student[/url].

A student is a learner, or someone who attends an educational institution.

A university is an institution of higher education and research, which grants academic degrees in a variety of subjects. A university is a corporation that provides both undergraduate education and postgraduate education.
name: University Student

description:
This character wears a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Collar]collar[/url].

A collar is any kind of clothing and garment that is worn around neck.

This trait is intended to be used for collars that are a separate piece of garment and not for the part of a shirt, coat, dress, blouse, etc.
name: Collar

description:
These are the traits about characters that change into something or someone else.

This trait is intended to be used for visible changes and does not mean character development like psychological changes within a character.
name: Transformation

description:
This character [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Metamorphosis]metamorphoses[/url] into something else.

Metamorphosis is a biological process by which an animal physically develops after birth or hatching, involving a conspicuous and relatively abrupt change in the animal's body structure through cell growth and differentiation.

Metamorphosis in fiction is not exclusive to animals.

Unlike shapeshifting, metamorphosis is permanent and there is no turning back.
name: Metamorphosis

description:
This character has the ability to [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Shapeshifting]shapeshift[/url] into something else.

Shapeshifting is a common theme in mythology and folklore as well as in science fiction and fantasy. In its broadest sense, it is when a being has the ability to alter its physical appearance. The transformation may be purposeful or not, depending on whether it has been the subject of a curse or spell. In some folklore, once the shapeshifter has become transformed, it becomes progressively more difficult for it to return to its original form.

Unlike metamorphosis, shapeshifting is not permanent and shapeshifter can change back.

This trait refers to changing the shape of the whole body and in that context do not cover partial transformations such as turning one's hands into claws.
name: Shapeshifting

description:
This character changes appearance with a henshin.

Henshin is the Japanese word for "transformation", literally meaning, "to change or transform the body." This word is primarily used in manga, anime, and tokusatsu dramas for when a character transforms into a superhero. Henshin heroes usually have a "henshin call", a catchphrase which they recite when they transform.

This trait is intended for characters that transform but retain their nature, so while it is valid for a human to human transformation, other forms are covered by shapeshifting and metamorphosis.
name: Henshin

description:
This character performs [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mammary_intercourse]mammary intercourse[/url] on another character. Apply [url=/i1627]i1627[/url] to the receiving character.

Mammary intercourse is a sexual act in which a woman stimulates a man's penis by rubbing it between her breasts. Alternatively, or additionally, the man may take a more active role by thrusting his penis between her breasts. Mammary intercourse may be combined with fellatio.

Do not confuse this with an alternate meaning of "boob job", referring to augmentive surgery done on the breasts.

[url=https://s.vndb.org/sf/97/119097.jpg]NSFW Example 1[/url]
[url=https://s.vndb.org/sf/98/119098.jpg]NSFW Example 2[/url]
name: Boobjob

description:
This character has sex in the [url=https://sexinfo101.com/positions/scissors/scissored-flagpole]seventh posture[/url] position. Apply this trait to the penetrated partner and apply [url=/i1701]i1701[/url] to the penetrating partner.

The receiving partner lies on their side, or on their back with their hips slightly rotated. The penetrating partner straddles the receiver's lower leg and faces them. The receiver's upper leg is lifted onto the crook of the penetrating partner's elbow or onto their shoulder.

[url=https://s.vndb.org/sf/53/79853.jpg]Example 1[/url]
[url=https://s.vndb.org/sf/24/7724.jpg]Example 2[/url], [url=https://s.vndb.org/sf/28/25528.jpg]Example 3[/url] - Lesbians engaging in tribadism
name: Seventh Posture

description:
This character wears a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lab_coat]lab coat[/url].

A laboratory coat is a knee-length overcoat/smock worn by professionals in the medical field or by those involved in laboratory work to protect their street clothes.

The garment is made from white or light-colored cotton, linen, or cotton polyester blend, allowing it to be washed at high temperature and make it easy to see if it is clean.
name: Lab Coat

description:
This character is a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Demon]demon[/url].

In religion and mythology, occultism and folklore, a demon is a supernatural being described as something that is not human and in ordinary usage malevolent.
name: Demon

description:
This character is the king of [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Demon]demons[/url].

Fiction about demons usually tells of a hierarchy in hell and a demon sits atop of all the others, this king is called Maou, basically the Japanese for demon king.

One thing to note is that Maou should not be mixed with Satan, because while Satan is a unique character from Christian Myth, the king of demons refers to a title held by, (usually) the most powerful demon in a wide range of myths.

This trait is intended to be used for a character who is the actual king of [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Demon]demons[/url] and not just a normal human who got it as a title, which seems to be a rather common title among dangerous elements.
name: Maou

description:
This character is [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Demon]demon[/url] blooded.

The character's lineage had some involvement with demons in the past. As a result of this, they have some some demonic powers as well as curses that they must bear the burden of.
name: Demon Blooded

description:
This character has [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Anemia]anemia[/url].

Anemia is a decrease in number of red blood cells (RBCs) or less than the normal quantity of hemoglobin in the blood. However, it can include decreased oxygen-binding ability of each hemoglobin molecule due to deformity or lack in numerical development as in some other types of hemoglobin deficiency. Anemia is the most common disorder of the blood.

People with anemia report non-specific symptoms of a feeling of weakness, or fatigue, general malaise and sometimes poor concentration. They may also report dyspnea (shortness of breath) on exertion. In very severe anemia, the body may compensate for the lack of oxygen-carrying capability of the blood by increasing cardiac output. The patient may have symptoms related to this, such as palpitations, angina (if preexisting heart disease is present), intermittent claudication of the legs, and symptoms of heart failure.
name: Anemia

description:
This character is a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Secondary_education]seconday education[/url] [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Student]student[/url].

Secondary education is the stage of education following primary school. Secondary education is generally the final stage of compulsory education. However, secondary education in some countries includes a period of compulsory and a period of non-compulsory education. The next stage of education is usually college or university.
name: High School Student

description:
This character is a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Superhuman]superhuman[/url].

Superhuman can mean an improved human, for example, by genetic modification, cybernetic implants, or as what humans might evolve into, in the distant future.

Occasionally, it could mean an otherwise "normal" human with unusual abilities, such as psychic abilities, flying abilities, unimaginable strength or exceptional proficiency at something, far beyond the norm.
name: Superhuman

description:
This character is a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Politician]politician[/url].

A politician is an individual who is involved in influencing public policy and decision making. This includes people who hold decision-making positions in government, and people who seek those positions, whether by means of election, coup d'état, appointment, electoral fraud, conquest, right of inheritance or other means.
name: Politician

description:
This character is a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Shogun]shogun[/url].

Shogun is a military rank and historical title for a hereditary military dictator of Japan. The modern rank is equivalent to a Generalissimo.
name: Shogun

description:
This character is an [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Emperor]empress consort[/url].

An empress consort is the wife of a reigning emperor. An empress consort usually shares her husband's rank and holds the feminine equivalent of the emperor's monarchical titles.
name: Empress Consort

description:
This character is an [url=http://dictionary.reference.com/browse/empress]empress[/url].

An empress is a female ruler of an empire or the consort of an emperor.
name: Empress

description:
This character is a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/King]king[/url].

A king is a male sovereign or monarch; a man who holds by life tenure, and usually by hereditary right, the chief authority over a country and people.
name: King

description:
This character is a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Healthcare_professional]healthcare professional[/url].

A healthcare professional is a person trained and knowledgeable in medicine, nursing or other allied health professions, or public/community health.
name: Healthcare Professional

description:
This character is a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pianist]pianist[/url].

A pianist is a musician who plays the piano.

A professional pianist can perform solo pieces, play with an ensemble or orchestra, or accompany one or more singers, solo instrumentalists, or other performers.
name: Pianist

description:
These are characters that play a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wind_instrument]wind instrument[/url].

A wind instrument is a musical instrument that contains some type of resonator (usually a tube), in which a column of air is set into vibration by the player blowing into (or over) a mouthpiece set at the end of the resonator.

The pitch of the vibration is determined by the length of the tube and by manual modifications of the effective length of the vibrating column of air. In the case of some wind instruments, sound is produced by blowing through a reed; others require buzzing into a metal mouthpiece.
name: Wind Instruments

description:
This character plays [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Harmonica]harmonica[/url].

The harmonica, also called harp, French harp, blues harp, and mouth organ, is a free reed wind instrument used primarily in blues and American folk music, jazz, country music, and rock and roll.

It is played by blowing air into it or drawing air out by placing lips over individual holes (reed chambers) or multiple holes. The pressure caused by blowing or drawing air into the reed chambers causes a reed or multiple reeds to vibrate up and down creating sound. Each chamber has multiple, variable-tuned brass or bronze reeds, which are secured at one end and loose on the other end, with the loose end vibrating and creating sound.
name: Harminist

description:
This character engages in [url=http://dictionary.reference.com/browse/disguise]disguise[/url].

Disguising characters change their appearance or guise of so as to conceal identity or mislead, as by means of deceptive garb.

A disguise can be anything which conceals or changes a person's physical appearance, including a wig, glasses, makeup, costume or other ways. Hats, glasses, change in hair style or wigs, plastic surgery, and make-up are also used. 

Disguises are used by criminals such as bank robbers and by spies seeking to avoid identification. A well-known person or celebrity may choose to go "incognito" in order to avoid unwelcome press attention.

This trait is intended for characters changing their appearance to pretend to be someone else, for other types of changes use the transformation trait family.
name: Disguise

description:
This character gets into a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Coma]coma[/url].

In medicine, a coma is a state of unconsciousness, lasting more than 6 hours in which a person cannot be awakened, fails to respond normally to painful stimuli, light or sound, lacks a normal sleep-wake cycle and does not initiate voluntary actions. A person in a state of coma is described as comatose.

Coma may result from a variety of conditions, including intoxication (such as illicit drug abuse, overdose or misuse of over the counter medications, prescribed medication, or controlled substances), metabolic abnormalities, central nervous system diseases, acute neurologic injuries such as strokes or herniations, hypoxia, hypothermia, hypoglycemia or traumatic injuries such as head trauma caused by falls or vehicle collisions. It may also be deliberately induced by pharmaceutical agents in order to preserve higher brain functions following brain trauma, or to save the patient from extreme pain during healing of injuries or diseases.
name: Coma

description:
This character is [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kindness]kind[/url].

Kindness is the act or the state of being kind —ie. marked by goodness and charitable behaviour, mild disposition, pleasantness, tenderness and concern for others. It is known as a virtue, and recognized as a value in many cultures and religions.
name: Kind

description:
This character is a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fairy]fairy[/url].

A fairy is a type of mythical being or legendary creature, a form of spirit, often described as metaphysical, supernatural or preternatural.

This trait is intended to be used for tiny fairies like [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tinker_Bell]Tinker Bell[/url] of the Peter Pan stories and should not be used for any other types of characters such as LotR inspired [url=http://vndb.org/i712]Elves[/url].
name: Fairy

description:
This character wears a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Beret]beret[/url].

A beret is a soft, round, flat-crowned hat, usually of woven or hand-knitted wool or wool felt, or these days often acrylic fiber.

Berets are worn as part of the uniform of many military and police units worldwide, as well as by other organizations.
name: Beret

description:
This character has [url=http://dictionary.reference.com/browse/wing]wings[/url].

Wings are either of the two forelimbs of most birds and of bats, corresponding to the human arms, that are specialized for flight or adapted for swimming, as in penguins. Or one of the paired, thin, lateral extensions of the body wall of an insect, located on the mesothorax and the metathorax, by means of which it flies. And in fiction, a similar structure with which gods, angels, demons, etc., are conceived to be provided for the purpose of flying.
name: Wings

description:
This character has [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Inferiority_complex]inferiority complex[/url].

An inferiority complex, in the fields of psychology and psychoanalysis, is a feeling that one is inferior to others in some way.

Such feelings can arise from an imagined or actual inferiority in the afflicted person. It is often subconscious, and is thought to drive afflicted individuals to overcompensate, resulting either in spectacular achievement or extreme schizotypal behavior, or both.

Unlike a normal feeling of inferiority, which can act as an incentive for achievement (or promote discouragement), an inferiority complex is an advanced state of discouragement, often embedding itself into one's lifestyle, and sometimes resulting in a retreat from difficulties.
name: Inferiority Complex

description:
This character becomes target of [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Teasing]teasing[/url].

Teasing comes in two major forms, playful and hurtful. When teasing is playful and friendly, and especially when it is reciprocal, teasing can be regarded as flirting.

People may be teased on such matters as their appearance, weight, behavior, abilities, and clothing. From the victim's point-of-view, this kind of teasing is often hurtful, irrespective of the intention of the teaser.

When teasing is unwelcome, it may be regarded as harassment or mobbing, especially in the work place, or as a form of bullying or emotional abuse. If done in public, it may be regarded as humiliation.
name: Teasing

description:
This character wears [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Court_shoe]court shoes[/url].

Court shoes are shoes with a low-cut front and usually without a fastening. However, some have ankle straps. They are usually worn by women, but are still traditional menswear in some formal situations, when they are sometimes called opera slippers or patent pumps.
name: Court Shoes

description:
This character is seen with a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bag]bag[/url].

A bag is a non-rigid container.
name: Bag

description:
This character is seen with a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Backpack]backpack[/url].

A backpack is, in its simplest form, a cloth sack carried on one's back and secured with two straps that go over the shoulders, but there can be exceptions. Lightweight types of backpacks are sometimes worn on only one shoulder strap.
name: Backpack

description:
This character wears a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Religious_habit]religious habit[/url].

A religious habit is a distinctive set of garments worn by members of a religious order.
name: Habit

description:
This character is [url=http://dictionary.reference.com/browse/clumsy]clumsy[/url] or known to be [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Accident-proneness]prone to accidents[/url].

A clumsy person is someone lacking in skill or physical coordination, who tends to be prone to more accidents then others.

Accident-proneness, also known as clumsiness, is the conception that some people might have predisposition, or that they might be more likely to suffer accidents, such as car crashes and industrial injuries, than other people. It may be used as a reason to deny any insurance on such individuals.
name: Clumsy

description:
This character is the head of a household.

Head of Household refers to individuals that are the leading member of a large household or family or tribe.

This trait is not connected to the tax term with the same name and should only be used for the leaders of big families, not all fathers, mothers etc.
name: Head of Household

description: This character is a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cat]cat[/url] or has cat-like physical features. This encompasses all forms of domesticated cats, including the common house cat breeds, as well as humanoid characters who possess cat-like traits.
name: Cat

description:
This character has sex in a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sexual_positions#Sitting_and_kneeling]sitting[/url] position. Apply this trait to the penetrated partner and apply [url=/i1691]i1691[/url] to the penetrating partner.

In this position, the penetrating partner sits with their torso mostly upright, while the receiving partner sits or squats over their lap, possibly leaning on the penetrating partner for support. They may face towards or away from the penetrating partner.

[url=https://s.vndb.org/sf/37/22737.jpg]Example 1[/url], [url=https://s.vndb.org/sf/36/84136.jpg]Example 2[/url] - Receiving partner facing away
[url=https://s.vndb.org/sf/37/84137.jpg]Example 3[/url] - Participants facing each other. Similar to [url=/i95]cowgirl[/url] position except penetrating partner is sitting mostly upright instead of lying down.
name: Sitting Sex

description:
This character is an [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Alchemist]alchemist[/url].

Alchemy refers to a quest for a fabled elixir or kimia (Old Persian for "elixir", later arabicized as alchemy) capable of turning copper and other base metals to gold and also a quest for something to prevent human beings' bodies from becoming old.

Alchemy is both a philosophy and an ancient practice that seeks to prepare the "elixir of longevity" or philosophers' stone, accomplish the transmutation into gold, and attain ultimate wisdom. It supposedly involves the manufacture of several substances with unusual properties, as well as improvement of the alchemist. Some alchemical sources treat the various substances, equipment and processes in an allegorical sense, as metaphors for a spiritual discipline.

Practical alchemy, on the other hand, can be viewed as a protoscience, the precursor to modern inorganic chemistry, having provided many procedures, equipment and names of substances that are still in use.
name: Alchemist

description:
This character is a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Psychic]psychic[/url].

A psychic is a person who professes an ability to perceive information hidden from the normal senses through extrasensory perception (ESP), or is said by others to have such abilities.
name: Psychic

description:
This character has some form of [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Precognition]precognitive[/url] powers that he/she uses in the story.

Precognition refers to perception that involves the acquisition or effect of future information that cannot be deduced from presently available and normally acquired sense-based information or laws of physics and/or nature. The related terms, premonition and presentiment refer to information about future events that is perceived as emotions.

The terms are usually used to denote a seemingly parapsychological or extrasensory process of perception, including clairvoyance.
name: Precog

description:
This character [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Boxing]boxes[/url].

Boxing is a combat sport in which two people fight each other using their fists for competition.

Boxing is typically supervised by a referee engaged in during a series of one- to three-minute intervals called rounds, and boxers generally of similar weight. There are four ways to win; if the opponent is knocked out and unable to get up before the referee counts to ten seconds (a knockout, or KO) or if the opponent is deemed too injured to continue (a Technical Knockout, or TKO), if an opponent is disqualified for breaking a rule, or if there is no stoppage of the fight before an agreed number of rounds, a winner is determined either by the referee's decision or by judges' scorecards.
name: Boxing

description:
This character is generally [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rude]rude[/url].

Rudeness is a display of disrespectfulness by not complying with the social "laws" or etiquette of a group or culture.

These laws have been established as the essential boundaries of normally accepted behavior. To be unable or unwilling to align one's behavior with these laws known to the general population of what is socially acceptable is to be rude.
name: Rude

description:
This character is a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cadet]cadet[/url].

A cadet is a trainee to become an officer in the military, often a person who is a junior trainee, a student in a national service academy or private military school or on a training ship.

This trait is intended to be used for the military context only, not for young nobles.
name: Cadet

description:
This character is a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gamer]gamer[/url].

Gamer refers to someone who frequently plays table-top games (boardgames and role playing games), wargames or video games.

While the term nominally includes those who do not necessarily consider themselves to be gamers (i.e., casual gamers), it is commonly used to identify those who spend much of their leisure time playing or learning about games.
name: Gamer

description:
This character plays [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lacrosse]lacrosse[/url].

Lacrosse is a team sport of Native American origin played using a small solid rubber ball and a long-handled stick called a crosse or lacrosse stick, mainly played on the East Coast of the United States and Canada.

The head of the lacrosse stick is strung with loose mesh designed to catch and hold the lacrosse ball. Offensively, the objective of the game is to score by shooting the ball into an opponent's goal, using the lacrosse stick to catch, carry, and pass the ball to do so. Defensively, the objective is to keep the opposing team from scoring and to dispossess them of the ball through the use of stick checking and body contact or positioning.
name: Lacrosse

description:
This character acts as a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Coach_%28sport%29]coach[/url].

In sports, a coach is an individual involved in the direction, instruction and training of the operations of a sports team or of individual sportspeople.

A coach can also be a person who instructs an actor or singer or any other type of a trainer.
name: Coach

description:
This character wears a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Military_uniform]military uniform[/url].

Military uniforms comprises standardized dress worn by members of the armed forces and paramilitaries of various nations.

Military dress and military styles have gone through great changes over the centuries from colourful and elaborate to extremely utilitarian. Military uniforms in the form of standardized and distinctive dress, intended for identification and display, are typically a sign of organized military forces equipped by a central authority.
name: Military Uniform

description:
This character pilots [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mecha]mecha[/url].

Mechs (plural), or mech (singular) is a broad genre of vehicles (normally walking vehicles) which are usually controlled by a pilot.

Mechs often appear in anime, science fiction, and other genres involving fantastic or futuristic elements. Mechs are generally, though not necessarily, bipedal and are best described ad a mix between a tank and a robot. Some mechs have arms, hands, and fingers capable of grasping objects. A mech that approximates the shape of a human body may allow the use of martial arts movements and swordsmanship, ceremonial acts of honor, saluting, and other human mannerisms.
name: Mecha Pilot

description:
This character wears a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sleeveless_shirt#Sleeveless_T-shirt]sleeveless shirt[/url].

A vest, undershirt, tank top, or a wife beater is an article of underwear worn underneath a dress shirt intended to protect them from body sweat and odors. It also makes dress shirts less transparent. The term most commonly refers to upper-body wear worn by males. It can also be worn during winter months as an extra layer of warmth.
name: Tank Top

description:
This character engages in [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Computer_programming]computer programming[/url].

Computer programming is the process of designing, writing, testing, debugging / troubleshooting, and maintaining the source code of computer programs.

This source code is written in a programming language. The purpose of programming is to create a program that exhibits a certain desired behavior. The process of writing source code often requires expertise in many different subjects, including knowledge of the application domain, specialized algorithms and formal logic.
name: Coder

description:
This character attempts to [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rape]rapes[/url] someone, but stops or gets stopped before penetration.

In criminal law, rape is a type of sexual assault usually involving sexual intercourse, which is initiated by one or more persons against another person without that person's consent.

This trait should also be used on characters that the games give the option to not to proceed with the rape.
name: Rape Attempt

description:
This character plays [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Paintball]paintball[/url].

Paintball is a sport in which players compete, in teams or individually, to eliminate opponents by hitting them with capsules containing food coloring and gelatin (referred to as paintballs) propelled from a device called a paintball marker.

Paintballs have a non-toxic, biodegradable, water soluble mineral-oil. The game is regularly played at a sporting level with organized competition involving worldwide leagues, tournaments, professional teams, and players.

Paintball technology is also used by armies to supplement military training, riot response, and non-lethal suppression of dangerous suspects.
name: Paintball

description:
This character plays [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Volleyball]volleyball[/url].

Volleyball is an Olympic team sport in which two teams of six players are separated by a net. Each team tries to score points by grounding a ball on the other team's court under organized rules.

The complete rules are extensive. But simply, play proceeds as follows: A player on one of the teams begins a 'rally' by serving the ball (tossing or releasing it and then hitting it with a hand or arm), from behind the back boundary line of the court, over the net, and into the receiving team's court. The receiving team must not let the ball be grounded within their court. They may touch the ball as many as three times. Typically, the first two touches are to set up for an attack, an attempt to direct the ball back over the net in such a way that the serving team is unable to prevent it from being grounded in their court.
name: Volleyball

description:
This character is a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Parrot]parrot[/url] or has parrot-like physical features.

Parrots are birds that are found in most tropical and subtropical regions.

Characteristic features of parrots include a strong, curved bill, an upright stance, strong legs, and clawed zygodactyl feet. Many parrots are vividly coloured, and some are multi-coloured. The plumage of cockatoos ranges from mostly white to mostly black, with a mobile crest of feathers on the tops of their heads.

Parrots, along with ravens, crows, jays and magpies, are among the most intelligent birds, and the ability of some species to imitate human voices enhances their popularity as pets.
name: Parrot

description:
This character wears a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jumpsuit]jumpsuit[/url].

Jumpsuit originally referred to the utilitarian one-piece garments used by parachuters/skydivers, but has come to be used as a common term for any one-piece garment with sleeves and legs.

The original skydivers' jumpsuits were simple garments designed to insulate the body from the cold of high altitudes and minimize risk of covering important handles and grips. Today, however, the garment has found other use.

Now its being used by pilots, drivers, sportspersons and tradesmen, such as cleaners, auto mechanics and plumbers as a means of protective clothing. It also finds use as a institutional uniform and clothing for children.
name: Jumpsuit

description:
This character wears a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pressure_suit]pressure suit[/url].

A pressure suit is a protective suit worn by high-altitude pilots who may fly at altitudes where the air pressure is too low for an unprotected person to survive, even breathing pure oxygen at positive pressure. Such suits may be either full-pressure (i.e. a space suit) or partial-pressure (as used by air crew). Partial-pressure suits work by providing mechanical counter-pressure to assist breathing at altitude.

Diving suits that protect the wearer from excessively high pressure are called atmospheric diving suits. Pressure suits in general are examples of environmental suits.
name: Pressure Suit

description:
This character wears [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dog_tag]dog tags[/url].

A dog tag is the informal name for the identification tags worn by military personnel, because of their resemblance to actual dog tags. The tag is primarily used for the identification of dead and wounded along with providing religion (to provide for calling a Catholic priest or Jewish rabbi for last rites) and essential basic medical information for the treatment of the latter, such as blood type and history of inoculations.

Dog tags are usually fabricated from a corrosion-resistant metal or alloy such as aluminum, monel or stainless-steel, although, during wartime, they have been made from whatever metals were available. In the event the member has a medical condition that requires special attention, an additional, red tag with the pertinent information is issued and worn with the dog tags.

Wearing of the tag is required at all times by soldiers in the field.
name: Dog Tags

description:
This character wears a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wedding_dress]wedding dress[/url].

A wedding dress or wedding gown is the clothing worn by a bride during a wedding ceremony. Color, style and ceremonial importance of the gown can depend on the religion and culture of the wedding participants.
name: Wedding Dress

description:
This character wears a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Swimsuit]swimsuit[/url].

A swimsuit is an item of clothing designed to be worn while engaging in a water-based activity or water sports, such as swimming, water polo, diving, surfing, water skiing, or during activities in the sun, such as sun bathing.

A swimsuit can also be worn as an undergarment in sports that require a wetsuit such as water skiing, scuba diving, surfing, and wakeboarding. Swimsuits are also worn when there is a need to display the body, as in the case of beauty pageants, or bodybuilding contests. Glamour photography and magazines like Sports Illustrated's annual "swimsuit issue" feature models and sports personalities in swimsuits.
name: Swimsuit

description:
This character wears a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bikini]bikini[/url].

The bikini is typically a women's swimsuit, either a one-piece or a two-piece. For the two-piece, one part of the attire is covering the breasts; the other the groin and, optionally, part or all of the buttocks, leaving an uncovered area between the two.

The bikini is often worn in hot weather, while swimming or sunning. A bikini is often worn as an undergarment to the wetsuit for waterskiing, scuba diving, surfing, and wakeboarding.

The shapes of both parts of a bikini resemble women's underwear, and the lower part can range from revealing thong or g-string to briefs and modest square-cut shorts.
name: Bikini

description:
This character wears [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Boardshorts]boardshorts[/url].

Boardshorts are a style of men's and, recently, women's swimwear. They were originally developed for aquatic sports, specifically for surfing, but in more recent years they have grown in popularity outside of these sports, and have become a popular form of general beach and swimwear.
name: Swim Shorts

description:
This character wears a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/One-piece_swimsuit]one-piece swimsuit[/url].

A one-piece swimsuit is a usually skin-tight one-piece swimsuit worn by women and girls when swimming in the sea or in a swimming pool, or for any activity in the sun, such as sun bathing. The one-piece swimsuit usually covers a female's torso.

Some women wear a one-piece swimsuit because they consider it to be more modest than a two-piece bikini. Before the popularity of the bikini, virtually all female swimsuits were one piece, and in older days men wore similar swimsuits that covered their whole torso.
name: One Piece Swimsuit

description:
This character [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Skiing]skis on snow[/url].

Skiing is a recreational activity using skis as equipment for traveling over snow. Skis are used in conjunction with boots that connect to the ski with use of a binding.

Skiing can be grouped into two general categories. The older of the two disciplines originated in Scandinavia and uses free-heel bindings that attach at the toes of the skier's boots but not at the heels. Types of Nordic skiing include cross-country, ski jumping and Telemark. Alpine skiing (more often called "downhill skiing"), originated in the European Alps, and is characterized by fixed-heel bindings that attach at both the toe and the heel of the skier's boot.
name: Skiing

description:
This character acts [url=http://dictionary.reference.com/browse/possessive]possessive[/url].

A possessive character is jealously opposed to the personal independence of, or to any influence other than one's own upon, a child, spouse, etc.
name: Possessive

description:
This character engages in [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cosplay]cosplay[/url].

Cosplay is a type of performance art in which participants don costumes and accessories to represent a specific character or idea. Characters are often drawn from popular fiction in Japan, but recent trends have included American cartoons and Sci-Fi. Favorite sources include manga, anime, tokusatsu, comic books, graphic novels, video games, hentai and fantasy movies. Any entity from the real or virtual world that lends itself to dramatic interpretation may be taken up as a subject. Inanimate objects are given anthropomorphic forms and it is not unusual to see genders switched, with women playing male roles and vice versa.

Cosplayers often interact to create a subculture centered around role play. A broader use of the term cosplay applies it to any costumed role play in venues apart from the stage, regardless of the cultural context.
name: Cosplay

description:
This character is a [url=http://dictionary.reference.com/browse/commander]commander[/url].

A commander is the commissioned officer in command of a military unit or installation.
name: Commander

description:
This character is an [url=http://dictionary.reference.com/browse/American]American[/url].

An American is an inhabitant of the United States of America, an American citizen.
name: American

description:
This character has a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tail]tail[/url] on her clothing.

The tail is the section at the rear end of an animal's body; in general, the term refers to a distinct, flexible appendage to the torso. It is the part of the body that corresponds roughly to the sacrum and coccyx in mammals and birds.

While tails are primarily a feature of vertebrates, some invertebrates including scorpions and springtails, as well as snails and slugs, have tail-like appendages that are sometimes referred to as tails.

This trait is intended for characters that have tails on their clothing as an accessory and should not be mixed with the body trait tail which refers to a real tail that is a part of a characters body.
name: Tail

description:
This character has an actual [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tail]tail[/url].

The tail is the section at the rear end of an animal's body; in general, the term refers to a distinct, flexible appendage to the torso. It is the part of the body that corresponds roughly to the sacrum and coccyx in mammals and birds.

While tails are primarily a feature of vertebrates, some invertebrates including scorpions and springtails, as well as snails and slugs, have tail-like appendages that are sometimes referred to as tails.

This trait is intended for characters that really have tails and should not be mixed with the clothing trait tail which refers to a clothing accessory.
name: Tail

description:
This character has one or more [url=http://dictionary.reference.com/browse/bell]bells[/url] on his/her clothing.

A bell is a hollow instrument of cast metal, typically cup-shaped with a flaring mouth, suspended from the vertex and rung by the strokes of a clapper, hammer, or the like.

The bell that appears as an accessory on animal collars and later as a clothing accessory on humans is usually ball shaped with a slit.
name: Bell (accessory)

description:
This character is a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Secretary]secretary[/url].

A secretary, or administrative assistant, is a person whose work consists of supporting management, including executives, using a variety of project management, communication & organizational skills. These functions may be entirely carried out to assist one other employee or may be for the benefit of more than one.

In other situations a secretary is an officer of a society or organization who deals with correspondence, admits new members and organizes official meetings and events.
name: Secretary

description:
This character's hair has one or more [url=http://translate.google.com/translate?sl=ja&tl=en&js=n&prev=_t&hl=en&ie=UTF-8&layout=2&eotf=1&u=http%3A%2F%2Fja.wikipedia.org%2Fwiki%2F%25E3%2582%25A4%25E3%2583%25B3%25E3%2583%2586%25E3%2583%25BC%25E3%2582%25AF_%2528%25E9%25AB%25AA%25E5%259E%258B%2529&act=url]intakes[/url].

An intake is created by an arch in the character's hair that folds over itself, creating an upside-down V shape. The intake itself should be on the second layer of hair, which has an opening with visible shadow(s) created by the arch folding over itself.

If the intake is right at the hairline, please use the [url=/i25]Curtained[/url] hairstyle trait instead.

[URL=/c4054]Example 1[/URL]
[URL=/c74]Example 2[/URL]
name: Intake

description:
This character is a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Russian]Russian[/url].

Russians are an ethnic group of the East Slavic people, primarily living in Russia and neighboring countries.
name: Russian

description:
This character is [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Finnish_people]Finnish[/url].

The terms Finns and Finnish people refer to the ethnic group historically associated with Finland or Fennoscandia, and they are only used in that sense here.
name: Finnish

description:
This character is a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mechanic]mechanic[/url].

A mechanic is a craftsman or technician who uses tools to repair machinery.
name: Mechanic

description:
This character takes part in [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Anal_sex]anal sex[/url] during a sexual scene. Use this trait on the penetrating partner and i1721 on the receiving partner.

Anal sex commonly refers to the sex act involving insertion of the penis into the anus of a sexual partner.

The term can also include other sexual acts involving the anus, including pegging, anal–oral sex, fingering, and object insertion.
name: Anal Sex

description:
This character is a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gurkha]gurkha[/url].

Gurkha are people from Nepal.
name: Gurkha

description:
This character is a communications officer.

In military, a communications officer is responsible for all kinds of communications between the command and the soldiers in the field.

In civil life, a communications officer coordinates the promotion of products, services and public image of an organization which may include the publication of news and press releases, brochures and/or related materials.
name: Communications Officer

description:
This character is a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Principal#Education]principal[/url].

A headmaster is the most senior teacher, leader and manager of a school. And in academic level, a principal is the chief executive and the chief academic officer of a university or college in certain parts of the Commonwealth.
name: Principal

description:
This character is an [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Emperor]emperor[/url].

An emperor is a male monarch, usually the sovereign ruler of an empire or another type of imperial realm.

Emperors are generally recognized to be of a higher honor and rank than kings.
name: Emperor

description:
This character is an [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Emperor]empress regnant[/url].

A empress regnant is a female monarch who reigns in her own right, in contrast to a "empress consort", who is the wife of a reigning emperor. Empress regnant possess and exercise sovereign powers.

Empresses are generally recognized to be of a higher honor and rank than queens.
name: Empress Regnant

description:
This character wears a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Headscarf]headscarf[/url].

Headscarves are scarves covering most or all of the top of a woman's hair and her head.

Headscarves may be worn for a variety of purposes, such as for warmth, for sanitation, for fashion or social distinction; with religious significance, to hide baldness, out of modesty, or other forms of social convention.
name: Headscarf

description:
This character is [url=http://dictionary.reference.com/browse/stubborn]stubborn[/url].

Stubborn characters are unreasonably, often perversely unyielding and bullheaded. They are firmly resolved or determined and resolute. Characterized by their perseverance, they are difficult to treat or deal with and resistant to treatment or efforts.
name: Stubborn

description:
This character wears a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Peaked_cap]peaked cap[/url].

A peaked cap is a form of headgear worn by the armed forces of many nations and also by many uniformed civilian organizations such as law enforcement agencies.

The cap has a crown, a band, and a peak (British English) or visor (American English). The crown is one color, often white for navies, light blue for air forces, and green for armies, and may be piped around the edge in a different color. The band can be one color, often black, or can be striped, vertically or horizontally. Most caps have some form of cap device (or cap badge). In the British Army, each regiment and corps has a different badge. In the American armed forces, the cap device is uniform throughout the branch of service, though different variants are used by different rank classes. The peak or visor is short, historically made of leather, or in newer caps may be a shiny plastic. Sometimes it is covered in fabric and may be adorned with embroidered ornamentation.
name: Peaked Cap

description:
This character is a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Captain]captain[/url].

A captain is the commanding person in charge of a ship, aircraft or similar vessel.
name: Captain

description:
This character is [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vietnamese]Vietnamese[/url].

Vietnamese refers to a member of the Vietnamese people, persons from Vietnam or of Vietnamese descent.
name: Vietnamese

description:
This character practices [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kendo]kendo[/url].

Kendo meaning "Way of The Sword", is a modern Japanese martial art of sword-fighting based on traditional samurai swordsmanship, or kenjutsu. Kendo is a physically and mentally challenging activity that combines strong martial arts values with sport-like physical elements.
name: Kendo

description:
This character plays [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Violin]violin[/url].

The violin is a string instrument, usually with four strings tuned in perfect fifths. It is the smallest, highest-pitched member of the violin family of string instruments, which includes the viola and cello.
name: Violinist

description:
These are the traits for the [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/String_instruments]string instruments[/url].

A string instrument is a musical instrument that produces sound by means of vibrating strings.

The most common string instruments in the string family are guitar, violin, viola, cello, double bass, banjo, mandolin, ukulele, and harp.
name: String Instruments

description:
This character has [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Brass_Knuckles]brass knuckles[/url].

Brass knuckles are weapons used in hand-to-hand combat. Brass knuckles are pieces of metal, usually steel despite their name, shaped to fit around the knuckles. Designed to preserve and concentrate a punch's force by directing it toward a harder and smaller contact area, they result in increased tissue disruption, including an increased likelihood of fracturing the victim's bones on impact. The extended and rounded palm grip also spreads across the attacker's palm the counter-force that would otherwise be absorbed primarily by the attacker's fingers, reducing the likelihood of damage to the attacker's fingers.
name: Brass Knuckles

description:
This character has [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Asthma]asthma[/url].

Asthma is a common chronic inflammatory disease of the airways characterized by variable and recurring symptoms, reversible airflow obstruction, and bronchospasm. Symptoms include wheezing, coughing, chest tightness, and shortness of breath.

It is thought to be caused by a combination of genetic and environmental factors. Treatment of acute symptoms is usually with an inhaled short-acting beta-2 agonist (such as salbutamol). Symptoms can be prevented by avoiding triggers, such as allergens and irritants, and by inhaling corticosteroids. Leukotriene antagonists are less effective than corticosteroids and thus less preferred.
name: Asthma

description:
This character is seen with a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Handbag]handbag[/url].

A handbag, or purse in American English, is a handled medium-to-large bag that is often fashionably designed, typically used by women, and used to hold personal items such as wallet/coins, keys, cosmetics, a hairbrush, mobile phone etc.
name: Handbag

description:
This character wears a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Crown_%28headgear%29]crown[/url].

A crown is the traditional symbolic form of headgear worn by a monarch or by a deity, for whom the crown traditionally represents power, legitimacy, immortality, righteousness, victory, triumph, resurrection, honour and glory of life after death. In art the crown may be shown being offered to those on Earth by angels. Apart from the traditional form, crowns also may be made of, for example, flowers, stars, oak leaves or thorns and be worn by others, representing what the coronation part aims to symbolize with the specific crown. They often contain jewels.
name: Crown

description: This character has a habit of using made-up words or coming up with unique sounds.
name: Made-up Words

description:
This character is seen with a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Stuffed_toy]stuffed toy[/url].

A stuffed toy is a toy sewn from cloth, plush, or other textiles, and stuffed with straw, beans, plastic pellets, cotton, synthetic fibres, or other similar materials. Stuffed toys are also known as plush toys (U.S. English) from plush, the outer material used, and soft toys or cuddly toys (British English).

Stuffed toys are made in many different forms, often resembling animals, legendary creatures, cartoon characters or inanimate objects. They are often used as comfort objects, for display or collecting and given as gifts, such as for graduation, Valentine's Day or birthdays.
name: Stuffed Toy

description:
This character is seen with a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Stuffed_toy]book[/url].

A book is a set or collection of written, printed, illustrated, or blank sheets, made of paper, parchment, or other various material, usually fastened together to hinge at one side. 

Books may also refer to works of literature, or a main division of such a work. In library and information science, a book is called a monograph, to distinguish it from serial periodicals such as magazines, journals or newspapers.
name: Book

description:
This character engages in [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Masturbation]masturbation[/url].

Masturbation refers to sexual stimulation of a person's genitals, usually to the point of orgasm.

The stimulation can be performed manually, by other types of bodily contact (short of sexual intercourse), by use of objects or tools, or by some combination of these methods. Self masturbation is a common form of autoeroticism. Masturbation with a partner, called mutual masturbation, is also common.
name: Masturbation

description:
Name of this character can be edited by the player.

This character may or may not have a default name, but the game allows the player to replace it with something else.
name: Nameable

description:
This character is one of the performers of a twin blowjob. Apply [url=/i1638]i1638[/url] to the receiving character.

A twin blowjob is a blowjob performed by two people at the same time on a single person.
name: Twin Blowjob

description:
This character wears a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nurse_uniform]nurse uniform[/url].

A nurse uniform is attire worn by nurses for hygiene and identification.
name: Nurse Uniform

description:
This character has a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Guan_Dao]guan dao[/url].

A guan dao is a type of Chinese pole weapon that is currently used in some forms of Chinese martial arts.

It is comparable to a European fauchard or glaive and consists of a heavy blade with a spike at the back and sometimes also a notch at the spike's upper base that can catch an opponent's weapon. In addition there are often irregular serrations that lead the back edge of the blade to the spike. The blade is mounted atop a 1.5 m to 1.8 m long wooden or metal pole with a pointed metal counter weight used to balance the heavy blade and for striking on the opposite end. The blade is very deeply curved and therefore unlike most polearms, solely useful for sweeping cuts where it relies on range and power.
name: Guan Dao

description:
This character has a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Scythe]scythe[/url].

A scythe is an agricultural hand tool for mowing grass, or reaping crops.

It consists of a wooden shaft about 170 centimetres long called a snaith, snath, snathe or sned (modern versions are sometimes made from metal or plastic). The snaith may be straight, or with an "S" curve, but the more sophisticated versions are curved in three dimensions, allowing the mower to stand more upright. The snaith has either one or two short handles at right angles to it – usually one near the upper end and always another roughly in the middle. A long, curved blade about 60 to 90 centimetres long is mounted at the lower end, perpendicular to the snaith. Scythes always have the blade projecting from the left side of the snaith when in use, with the edge towards the mower. In principle a left-handed scythe could be made, but it could not be used together with right-handed scythes in a team of mowers, as the left-handed mower would be mowing in the opposite direction.
name: Scythe

description:
This character has a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pole_weapon]polearm[/url].

A pole weapon is a close combat weapon in which the main fighting part of the weapon is placed on the end of a long shaft, typically of wood, thereby extending the user's effective range.

Spears, glaives, poleaxes, halberds, and bardiches are all varieties of polearms. The idea of attaching a weapon onto a long shaft is an old one, as the first spears date back to the Stone Age. The purpose of using pole weapons is either to extend reach or to increase angular momentum—and thus striking power—when the weapon is swung.

This trait is intended to be used for made up or unidentified types of pole weapons that are not mentioned above, for those use (or make) the appropriate trait.
name: Polearm

description:
This character has a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Blade]blade[/url].

This trait is intended to be used for made up or unidentified types of blades that does not have well known real world counterparts, for the common types of blades, like [url=http://vndb.org/i73]swords[/url] and [url=http://vndb.org/i201]knives[/url] use (or make) the appropriate traits.
name: Blade

description:
This character is seen with a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hand_fan]fan[/url].

A hand-held fan is an implement used to induce an airflow for the purpose of cooling or refreshing oneself. Any broad, flat surface waved back-and-forth will create a small airflow and therefore can be considered a rudimentary fan. But generally, purpose-made hand-held fans are shaped like a sector of a circle and made of a thin material (such as paper or feathers) mounted on slats which revolve around a pivot so that it can be closed when not in use.

The movement of a hand-held fan provides cooling by increasing the airflow over the skin which in turn increases the evaporation rate of sweat droplets on the skin. This evaporation has a cooling effect due to the latent heat of evaporation of water. Fans are convenient to carry around, especially folding fans.
name: Hand Fan

description:
